verses.textEn: He has not dealt with us according to our sins, and he has not repaid us according to our iniquities.
verses.textLa: Non secundum peccata nostra fecit nobis: neque secundum iniquitates nostras retribuit nobis.

verses.textEn: For according to the height of the heavens above the earth, so has he reinforced his mercy toward those who fear him.
verses.textLa: Quoniam secundum altitudinem cæli a terra: corroboravit misericordiam suam super timentes se.

verses.textEn: As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our iniquities from us.
verses.textLa: Quantum distat Ortus ab Occidente: longe fecit a nobis iniquitates nostras.

verses.textEn: As a father is compassionate to his sons, so has the Lord been compassionate to those who fear him.
verses.textLa: Quomodo miseretur pater filiorum, misertus est Dominus timentibus se:

verses.textEn: For he knows our form. He has called to mind that we are dust.
verses.textLa: quoniam ipse cognovit figmentum nostrum. Recordatus est quoniam pulvis sumus:

verses.textEn: Man: his days are like hay. Like the flower of the field, so will he flourish.
verses.textLa: homo, sicut fœnum dies eius, tamquam flos agri sic efflorebit.

verses.textEn: For the spirit in him will pass away, and it will not remain, and he will know his place no longer.
verses.textLa: Quoniam spiritus pertransibit in illo, et non subsistet: et non cognoscet amplius locum suum.

verses.textEn: But the mercy of the Lord is from eternity, and even unto eternity, upon those who fear him. And his justice is with the sons of the sons,
verses.textLa: Misericordia autem Domini ab æterno, et usque in æternum super timentes eum. Et iustitia illius in filios filiorum,

verses.textEn: with those who serve his covenant and have been mindful of his commandments by doing them.
verses.textLa: his qui servant testamentum eius: Et memores sunt mandatorum ipsius, ad faciendum ea.

verses.textEn: The Lord has prepared his throne in heaven, and his kingdom will rule over all.
verses.textLa: Dominus in cælo paravit sedem suam: et regnum ipsius omnibus dominabitur.

verses.textEn: Bless the Lord, all you his Angels: powerful in virtue, doing his word, in order to heed the voice of his discourse.
verses.textLa: Benedicite Domino omnes angeli eius: potentes virtute, facientes verbum illius, ad audiendam vocem sermonum eius.

verses.textEn: Bless the Lord, all his hosts: his ministers who do his will.
verses.textLa: Benedicite Domino omnes virtutes eius: ministri eius, qui facitis voluntatem eius.

verses.textEn: Bless the Lord, all his works: in every place of his dominion. Bless the Lord, O my soul.
verses.textLa: Benedicite Domino omnia opera eius: in omni loco dominationis eius, benedic anima mea Domino.

verses.textEn: To David himself. Bless the Lord, O my soul. O Lord my God, you are exceedingly great. You have clothed yourself with confession and beauty;
verses.textLa: Ipsi David. Benedic anima mea Domino: Domine Deus meus magnificatus es vehementer. Confessionem, et decorem induisti:

verses.textEn: you are dressed with light like a garment, while you stretch out heaven like a tent.
verses.textLa: amictus lumine sicut vestimento: Extendens cælum sicut pellem:

verses.textEn: You cover its heights with water. You set the clouds as your stairs. You walk upon the wings of the winds.
verses.textLa: qui tegis aquis superiora eius. Qui ponis nubem ascensum tuum: qui ambulas super pennas ventorum.

verses.textEn: You make your Angels a breath of life, and your ministers a burning fire.
verses.textLa: Qui facis angelos tuos, spiritus: et ministros tuos ignem urentem.

verses.textEn: You founded the earth upon its stable base. It will not be bent from age to age.
verses.textLa: Qui fundasti terram super stabilitatem suam: non inclinabitur in sæculum sæculi.

verses.textEn: The abyss, like a garment, is its clothing. The waters will remain standing above the mountains.
verses.textLa: Abyssus, sicut vestimentum, amictus eius: super montes stabunt aquæ.

verses.textEn: At your rebuke, they will flee. At the voice of your thunder, they will dread.
verses.textLa: Ab increpatione tua fugient: a voce tonitrui tui formidabunt.

verses.textEn: The mountains ascend, and the plains descend, to the place which you have founded for them.
verses.textLa: Ascendunt montes: et descendunt campi in locum, quem fundasti eis.

verses.textEn: You have set a limit that they will not cross. And they will not return to cover the earth.
verses.textLa: Terminum posuisti, quem non transgredientur: neque convertentur operire terram.

verses.textEn: You spring forth fountains in steep valleys. The waters will cross through the midst of the mountains.
verses.textLa: Qui emittis fontes in convallibus: inter medium montium pertransibunt aquæ.

verses.textEn: All the wild beasts of the field will drink. The wild donkeys will anticipate in their thirst.
verses.textLa: Potabunt omnes bestiæ agri: expectabunt onagri in siti sua.

verses.textEn: Above them, the flying things of the air will dwell. From the midst of the rocks, they will utter voices.
verses.textLa: Super ea volucres cæli habitabunt: de medio petrarum dabunt voces.

verses.textEn: You irrigate the mountains from your heights. The earth will be satiated from the fruit of your works,
verses.textLa: Rigans montes de superioribus suis: de fructu operum tuorum satiabitur terra:

verses.textEn: producing grass for cattle and herbs for the service of men. So may you draw bread from the earth,
verses.textLa: Producens fœnum iumentis, et herbam servituti hominum: Ut educas panem de terra:

verses.textEn: and wine, in order to cheer the heart of man. Then he may gladden his face with oil, and bread will confirm the heart of man.
verses.textLa: et vinum lætificet cor hominis: Ut exhilaret faciem in oleo: et panis cor hominis confirmet.

verses.textEn: The trees of the field will be saturated, along with the cedars of Lebanon, which he planted.
verses.textLa: Saturabuntur ligna campi, et cedri Libani, quas plantavit:

verses.textEn: There, the sparrows will make their nests. The leader of them is the house of the heron.
verses.textLa: illic passeres nidificabunt. Herodii domus dux est eorum:
verses.notes: Notice that in Latin, ‘heron’ is ‘Herod,’ making this verse a spiritual reference to Herod the great, and to other evil leaders who follow in his footsteps.

verses.textEn: The heights of the hills are for the deer; the rock is a refuge for the hedgehog.
verses.textLa: montes excelsi cervis: petra refugium herinaciis.

verses.textEn: He has made the moon for seasons; the sun knows its setting.
verses.textLa: Fecit lunam in tempora: sol cognovit occasum suum.

verses.textEn: You appointed darkness, and it has become night; all the beasts of the forest will cross through it.
verses.textLa: Posuisti tenebras, et facta est nox: in ipsa pertransibunt omnes bestiæ silvæ.

verses.textEn: The young lions will roar, while searching for and seizing their meal from God.
verses.textLa: Catuli leonum rugientes, ut rapiant, et quærant a Deo escam sibi.

verses.textEn: The sun arose, and they were gathered together; and in their dens, they will lie down together.
verses.textLa: Ortus est sol, et congregati sunt: et in cubilibus suis collocabuntur.

verses.textEn: Man will go forth to his work and to his activities, until the evening.
verses.textLa: Exibit homo ad opus suum: et ad operationem suam usque ad vesperum.

verses.textEn: How great are your works, O Lord! You have made all things in wisdom. The earth has been filled with your possessions.
verses.textLa: Quam magnificata sunt opera tua Domine! omnia in sapientia fecisti: impleta est terra possessione tua.

verses.textEn: This sea is great and its hands are spacious. There are creeping things without number: the small animals with the great.
verses.textLa: Hoc mare magnum, et spatiosum manibus: illic reptilia, quorum non est numerus. Animalia pusilla cum magnis:
verses.notes: Or, ‘animals great and small.’

verses.textEn: There, the ships will pass by this sea-serpent that you have formed to mock them.
verses.textLa: illic naves pertransibunt. Draco iste, quem formasti ad illudendum ei:

verses.textEn: All these expect you to give them food in due time.
verses.textLa: omnia a te expectant ut des illis escam in tempore.

verses.textEn: What you give to them, they will gather. When you open your hand, they will all be filled with goodness.
verses.textLa: Dante te illis, colligent: aperiente te manum tuam, omnia implebuntur bonitate.

verses.textEn: But if you turn your face away, they will be disturbed. You will take away their breath, and they will fail, and they will return to their dust.
verses.textLa: Avertente autem te faciem, turbabuntur: auferes spiritum eorum, et deficient, et in pulverem suum revertentur.

verses.textEn: You will send forth your Spirit, and they will be created. And you will renew the face of the earth.
verses.textLa: Emittes Spiritum tuum, et creabuntur: et renovabis faciem terræ.

verses.textEn: May the glory of the Lord be for all ages. The Lord will rejoice in his works.
verses.textLa: Sit gloria Domini in sæculum: lætabitur Dominus in operibus suis:

verses.textEn: He considers the earth, and he makes it tremble. He touches the mountains, and they smoke.
verses.textLa: Qui respicit terram, et facit eam tremere: qui tangit montes, et fumigant.

verses.textEn: I will sing to the Lord with my life. I will sing psalms to my God, as long as I am.
verses.textLa: Cantabo Domino in vita mea: psallam Deo meo quamdiu sum.
verses.notes: A holy life is a pure and pleasing song to the Lord. I will sing to the Lord with my life.

verses.textEn: May my speech be pleasing to him. Truly, I will take delight in the Lord.
verses.textLa: Iucundum sit ei eloquium meum: ego vero delectabor in Domino.

verses.textEn: Let sinners fade away from the earth, along with the unjust, so that they may not be. Bless the Lord, O my soul.
verses.textLa: Deficiant peccatores a terra, et iniqui ita ut non sint: benedic anima mea Domino.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Confess to the Lord, and invoke his name. Announce his works among the nations.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Confitemini Domino, et invocate nomen eius: annunciate inter gentes opera eius.

verses.textEn: Sing to him, and sing psalms to him. Describe all his wonders.
verses.textLa: Cantate ei, et psallite ei: narrate omnia mirabilia eius.

verses.textEn: Be praised in his holy name. Let the heart of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
verses.textLa: Laudamini in nomine sancto eius: lætetur cor quærentium Dominum.

verses.textEn: Seek the Lord, and be confirmed. Seek his face always.
verses.textLa: Quærite Dominum, et confirmamini: quærite faciem eius semper.

verses.textEn: Remember his miracles, which he has done, his portents and the judgments of his mouth:
verses.textLa: Mementote mirabilium eius, quæ fecit: prodigia eius, et iudicia oris eius.

verses.textEn: you offspring of Abraham his servant, you sons of Jacob his elect.
verses.textLa: Semen Abraham, servi eius: filii Iacob electi eius.

verses.textEn: He is the Lord our God. His judgments are throughout the entire earth.
verses.textLa: Ipse Dominus Deus noster: in universa terra iudicia eius.

verses.textEn: He has remembered his covenant for all ages: the word that he entrusted to a thousand generations,
verses.textLa: Memor fuit in sæculum testamenti sui: verbi, quod mandavit in mille generationes:

verses.textEn: which he assigned to Abraham, and his oath to Isaac.
verses.textLa: Quod disposuit ad Abraham: et iuramenti sui ad Isaac:

verses.textEn: And he stationed the same for Jacob with a precept, and for Israel with an eternal testament,
verses.textLa: Et statuit illud Iacob in præceptum: et Israel in testamentum æternum:

verses.textEn: saying: To you, I will give the land of Canaan, the allotment of your inheritance.
verses.textLa: Dicens: Tibi dabo Terram Chanaan, funiculum hereditatis vestræ.
verses.notes: Literally, ‘the line of your inheritance.’ A line or string was used to cast a certain type of lot.

verses.textEn: Though they may have been but a small number, very few and foreigners there,
verses.textLa: Cum essent numero brevi, paucissimi et incolæ eius:

verses.textEn: and though they passed from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people,
verses.textLa: Et pertransierunt de gente in gentem, et de regno ad populum alterum.

verses.textEn: he allowed no man to harm them, and he reproved kings on their behalf.
verses.textLa: Non reliquit hominem nocere eis: et corripuit pro eis reges.

verses.textEn: Do not be willing to touch my Christ, and do not be willing to malign my prophets.
verses.textLa: Nolite tangere Christos meos: et in prophetis meis nolite malignari.

verses.textEn: And he called a famine upon the land, and he crushed every foundation of the bread.
verses.textLa: Et vocavit famem super terram: et omne firmamentum panis contrivit.

verses.textEn: He sent a man before them: Joseph, who had been sold as a slave.
verses.textLa: Misit ante eos virum: in servum venundatus est Ioseph.

verses.textEn: They humbled his feet in shackles; the iron pierced his soul,
verses.textLa: Humiliaverunt in compedibus pedes eius, ferrum pertransiit animam eius,

verses.textEn: until his word arrived. The eloquence of the Lord inflamed him.
verses.textLa: donec veniret verbum eius. Eloquium Domini inflammavit eum:

verses.textEn: The king sent and released him; he was the ruler of the people, and he dismissed him.
verses.textLa: misit rex, et solvit eum; princeps populorum, et dimisit eum.

verses.textEn: He established him as master of his house and ruler of all his possessions,
verses.textLa: Constituit eum dominum domus suæ: et principem omnis possessionis suæ:

verses.textEn: so that he might instruct his princes as himself, and teach his elders prudence.
verses.textLa: Ut erudiret principes eius sicut semetipsum: et senes eius prudentiam doceret.

verses.textEn: And Israel entered into Egypt, and Jacob became a sojourner in the land of Ham.
verses.textLa: Et intravit Israel in Ægyptum: et Iacob accola fuit in Terra Cham.

verses.textEn: And he helped his people greatly, and he strengthened them over their enemies.
verses.textLa: Et auxit populum suum vehementer: et firmavit eum super inimicos eius.

verses.textEn: He turned their heart to hate his people, and to deal deceitfully with his servants.
verses.textLa: Convertit cor eorum ut odirent populum eius: et dolum facerent in servos eius.

verses.textEn: He sent Moses, his servant, and Aaron, the one whom he chose.
verses.textLa: Misit Moysen servum suum: Aaron, quem elegit ipsum.

verses.textEn: He placed with them signs of his word, and portents in the land of Ham.
verses.textLa: Posuit in eis verba signorum suorum, et prodigiorum in Terra Cham.

verses.textEn: He sent darkness and made it conceal, and he did not afflict them with his speech.
verses.textLa: Misit tenebras, et obscuravit: et non exacerbavit sermones suos.
verses.notes: They would not listen to God’s word, so He in turn did not aggravate them by continuing to speak to them. Instead, he gave them signs in the form of afflictions.

verses.textEn: He turned their waters into blood, and he slaughtered their fish.
verses.textLa: Convertit aquas eorum in sanguinem: et occidit pisces eorum.

verses.textEn: Their land brought forth frogs, even in the inner chambers of their kings.
verses.textLa: Edidit terra eorum ranas in penetralibus regum ipsorum.

verses.textEn: He spoke, and there came forth common flies and gnats, in every region.
verses.textLa: Dixit, et venit cœnomyia: et cinifes in omnibus finibus eorum.

verses.textEn: He gave them a shower of hail and a burning fire, in the same land.
verses.textLa: Posuit pluvias eorum grandinem: ignem comburentem in terra ipsorum.

verses.textEn: And he struck their vineyards and their fig trees, and he crushed the trees of their region.
verses.textLa: Et percussit vineas eorum, et ficulneas eorum: et contrivit lignum finium eorum.

verses.textEn: He spoke, and the locust came forth, and the caterpillar, of which there was no number.
verses.textLa: Dixit, et venit locusta, et bruchus, cuius non erat numerus:

verses.textEn: And it devoured all the grass in their land, and it consumed all the fruit of their land.
verses.textLa: Et comedit omne fœnum in terra eorum: et comedit omnem fructum terræ eorum.

verses.textEn: And he struck all the first-born in their land, the first-fruits of all their labor.
verses.textLa: Et percussit omne primogenitum in terra eorum: primitias omnis laboris eorum.

verses.textEn: And he led them out with silver and gold, and there was not an infirm one among their tribes.
verses.textLa: Et eduxit eos cum argento et auro: et non erat in tribubus eorum infirmus.

verses.textEn: Egypt was joyful at their departure, for the fear of them lay heavy upon them.
verses.textLa: Lætata est Ægyptus in profectione eorum: quia incubuit timor eorum super eos.

verses.textEn: He spread a cloud for their protection, and a fire, to give them light through the night.
verses.textLa: Expandit nubem in protectionem eorum, et ignem ut luceret eis per noctem.

verses.textEn: They petitioned, and the quail came; and he satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
verses.textLa: Petierunt, et venit coturnix: et pane cæli saturavit eos.

verses.textEn: He ruptured the rock and the waters flowed: rivers gushed in the dry land.
verses.textLa: Dirupit petram, et fluxerunt aquæ: abierunt in sicco flumina;

verses.textEn: For he had called to mind his holy word, which he kept near to his servant Abraham.
verses.textLa: Quoniam memor fuit verbi sancti sui, quod habuit ad Abraham puerum suum.

verses.textEn: And he led forth his people in exultation, and his elect in rejoicing.
verses.textLa: Et eduxit populum suum in exultatione, et electos suos in lætitia.

verses.textEn: And he gave them the regions of the Gentiles, and they possessed the labors of the peoples,
verses.textLa: Et dedit illis regiones Gentium: et labores populorum possederunt:

verses.textEn: so that they might observe his justifications, and inquire about his law.
verses.textLa: Ut custodiant iustificationes eius, et legem eius requirant.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Confess to the Lord, for he is good, for his mercy is with every generation.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Confitemini Domino quoniam bonus: quoniam in sæculum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Who will declare the powers of the Lord? Who make a hearing for all his praises?
verses.textLa: Quis loquetur potentias Domini, auditas faciet omnes laudes eius?

verses.textEn: Blessed are those who keep judgment and who do justice at all times.
verses.textLa: Beati, qui custodiunt iudicium, et faciunt iustitiam in omni tempore.

verses.textEn: Remember us, O Lord, with good will for your people. Visit us with your salvation,
verses.textLa: Memento nostri Domine in beneplacito populi tui: visita nos in salutari tuo:

verses.textEn: so that we may see the goodness of your elect, so that we may rejoice in the joy of your nation, so that you may be praised along with your inheritance.
verses.textLa: Ad videndum in bonitate electorum tuorum, ad lætandum in lætitia gentis tuæ: ut lauderis cum hereditate tua.

verses.textEn: We have sinned, as have our fathers. We have acted unjustly; we have wrought iniquity.
verses.textLa: Peccavimus cum patribus nostris: iniuste egimus, iniquitatem fecimus.

verses.textEn: Our fathers did not understand your miracles in Egypt. They did not remember the multitude of your mercies. And they provoked you, while going up to the sea, even the Red Sea.
verses.textLa: Patres nostri in Ægypto non intellexerunt mirabilia tua: non fuerunt memores multitudinis misericordiæ tuæ. Et irritaverunt ascendentes in mare, Mare Rubrum.

verses.textEn: And he saved them for the sake of his name, so that he might make known his power.
verses.textLa: Et salvavit eos propter nomen suum: ut notam faceret potentiam suam.

verses.textEn: And he rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up. And he led them into the abyss, as if into a desert.
verses.textLa: Et increpuit Mare Rubrum, et exiccatum est: et deduxit eos in abyssis sicut in deserto.

verses.textEn: And he saved them from the hand of those who hated them. And he redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
verses.textLa: Et salvavit eos de manu odientium: et redemit eos de manu inimici.

verses.textEn: And the water covered those who troubled them. Not one of them remained.
verses.textLa: Et operuit aqua tribulantes eos: unus ex eis non remansit.

verses.textEn: And they believed his words, and they sang his praises.
verses.textLa: Et crediderunt verbis eius: et laudaverunt laudem eius.

verses.textEn: As soon as they had finished, they forgot his works, and they would not endure his counsel.
verses.textLa: Cito fecerunt, obliti sunt operum eius: et non sustinuerunt consilium eius.

verses.textEn: And they coveted their desire in the desert, and they tempted God in a waterless place.
verses.textLa: Et concupierunt concupiscentiam in deserto: et tentaverunt Deum in inaquoso.

verses.textEn: And he granted to them their request, and he sent abundance into their souls.
verses.textLa: Et dedit eis petitionem ipsorum: et misit saturitatem in animas eorum.

verses.textEn: And they provoked Moses in the camp, and Aaron, the holy one of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et irritaverunt Moysen in castris: Aaron sanctum Domini.

verses.textEn: The earth opened and swallowed Dathan, and it covered the congregation of Abiram.
verses.textLa: Aperta est terra, et deglutivit Dathan: et operuit super congregationem Abiron.

verses.textEn: And a fire broke out in their congregation. A flame burned up the sinners.
verses.textLa: Et exarsit ignis in synagoga eorum: flamma combussit peccatores.

verses.textEn: And they fashioned a calf at Horeb, and they adored a graven image.
verses.textLa: Et fecerunt vitulum in Horeb: et adoraverunt sculptile.

verses.textEn: And they exchanged their glory for the likeness of a calf that eats hay.
verses.textLa: Et mutaverunt gloriam suam in similitudinem vituli comedentis fœnum.

verses.textEn: They forgot God, who saved them, who did great things in Egypt:
verses.textLa: Obliti sunt Deum, qui salvavit eos, qui fecit magnalia in Ægypto,

verses.textEn: miracles in the land of Ham, terrible things at the Red Sea.
verses.textLa: mirabilia in Terra Cham: terribilia in Mari Rubro.

verses.textEn: And he said that he would destroy them, yet Moses, his elect, stood firm before him in the breach, in order to avert his wrath, lest he destroy them.
verses.textLa: Et dixit ut disperderet eos: si non Moyses electus eius stetisset in confractione in conspectu eius: Ut averteret iram eius ne disperderet eos:

verses.textEn: And they held the desirable land to be nothing. They did not trust in his word.
verses.textLa: et pro nihilo habuerunt terram desiderabilem: Non crediderunt verbo eius,

verses.textEn: And they murmured in their tabernacles. They did not heed the voice of the Lord.
verses.textLa: et murmuraverunt in tabernaculis suis: non exaudierunt vocem Domini.

verses.textEn: And he lifted up his hand over them, in order to prostrate them in the desert,
verses.textLa: Et elevavit manum suam super eos: ut prosterneret eos in deserto:

verses.textEn: and in order to cast their offspring among the nations, and to scatter them among the regions.
verses.textLa: Et ut deiiceret semen eorum in Nationibus: et dispergeret eos in regionibus.

verses.textEn: And they were initiated into Baal of Peor, and they ate the sacrifices of the dead.
verses.textLa: Et initiati sunt Beelphegor: et comederunt sacrificia mortuorum.

verses.textEn: And they provoked him with their inventions, and ruination was multiplied in them.
verses.textLa: Et irritaverunt eum in adinventionibus suis: et multiplicata est in eis ruina.

verses.textEn: Then Phinehas stood up and placated him: and so the violent disturbance ceased.
verses.textLa: Et stetit Phinees, et placavit: et cessavit quassatio.

verses.textEn: And it was reputed to him unto justice, from generation to generation, even forever.
verses.textLa: Et reputatum est ei in iustitiam, in generationem et generationem usque in sempiternum.

verses.textEn: And they provoked him at the Waters of Contradiction, and Moses was afflicted because of them,
verses.textLa: Et irritaverunt eum ad Aquas Contradictionis: et vexatus est Moyses propter eos:

verses.textEn: for they exasperated his spirit. And so he divided them with his lips.
verses.textLa: quia exacerbaverunt spiritum eius. Et distinxit in labiis suis:

verses.textEn: They did not destroy the nations, about which the Lord had spoken to them.
verses.textLa: non disperdiderunt gentes, quas dixit Dominus illis.

verses.textEn: And they were mixed among the Gentiles. And they learned their works,
verses.textLa: Et commisti sunt inter Gentes, et didicerunt opera eorum:

verses.textEn: and they served their graven images, and it became a scandal to them.
verses.textLa: et servierunt sculptilibus eorum: et factum est illis in scandalum.

verses.textEn: And they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.
verses.textLa: Et immolaverunt filios suos, et filias suas dæmoniis.

verses.textEn: And they shed innocent blood: the blood of their sons and of their daughters, which they sacrificed to the graven images of Canaan. And the land was infected with bloodshed,
verses.textLa: Et effuderunt sanguinem innocentem: sanguinem filiorum suorum et filiarum suarum, quas sacrificaverunt sculptilibus Chanaan. Et infecta est terra in sanguinibus,

verses.textEn: and was contaminated with their works. And they fornicated according to their own inventions.
verses.textLa: et contaminata est in operibus eorum: et fornicati sunt in adinventionibus suis.

verses.textEn: And the Lord became furiously angry with his people, and he abhorred his inheritance.
verses.textLa: Et iratus est furore Dominus in populum suum: et abominatus est hereditatem suam.

verses.textEn: And he delivered them into the hands of the nations. And those who hated them became rulers over them.
verses.textLa: Et tradidit eos in manus gentium: et dominati sunt eorum qui oderunt eos.

verses.textEn: And their enemies afflicted them, and they were humbled under their hands.
verses.textLa: Et tribulaverunt eos inimici eorum, et humiliati sunt sub manibus eorum:

verses.textEn: Many times, he delivered them. Yet they provoked him with their counsel, and they were brought low by their iniquities.
verses.textLa: sæpe liberavit eos. Ipsi autem exacerbaverunt eum in consilio suo: et humiliati sunt in iniquitatibus suis.

verses.textEn: And he saw that they were in tribulation, and he heard their prayer.
verses.textLa: Et vidit cum tribularentur: et audivit orationem eorum.

verses.textEn: And he was mindful of his covenant, and he repented according to the multitude of his mercies.
verses.textLa: Et memor fuit testamenti sui: et pœnituit eum secundum multitudinem misericordiæ suæ.

verses.textEn: And he provided for them with mercies, in the sight of all those who had seized them.
verses.textLa: Et dedit eos in misericordias in conspectu omnium qui ceperant eos.

verses.textEn: Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from the nations, so that we may confess your holy name and glory in your praise.
verses.textLa: Salvos nos fac Domine Deus noster: et congrega nos de Nationibus: Ut confiteamur nomini sancto tuo: et gloriemur in laude tua.

verses.textEn: Blessed is the Lord God of Israel, from ages past, even to all ages. And let all the people say: Amen. Amen.
verses.textLa: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israel a sæculo et usque in sæculum: et dicet omnis populus: Fiat, fiat.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Confess to the Lord, for he is good, for his mercy is with every generation.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Confitemini Domino quoniam bonus: quoniam in sæculum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Let those who have been redeemed by the Lord say so: those whom he redeemed from the hand of the enemy and gathered from the regions,
verses.textLa: Dicant qui redempti sunt a Domino, quos redemit de manu inimici: et de regionibus congregavit eos:

verses.textEn: from the rising of the sun and its setting, from the north and from the sea.
verses.textLa: A solis ortu, et occasu: ab Aquilone, et mari.

verses.textEn: They wandered into solitude in a waterless place. They did not find the way of the city to be their dwelling place.
verses.textLa: Erraverunt in solitudine in inaquoso: viam civitatis habitaculi non invenerunt,

verses.textEn: They were hungry, and they were thirsty. Their soul fainted within them.
verses.textLa: Esurientes, et sitientes: anima eorum in ipsis defecit.

verses.textEn: And they cried out to the Lord in tribulation, and he rescued them in their necessity.
verses.textLa: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur: et de necessitatibus eorum eripuit eos.

verses.textEn: And he led them in the right way, so that they might go forth to a city of habitation.
verses.textLa: Et deduxit eos in viam rectam: ut irent in civitatem habitationis.
verses.notes: Or, ‘on a straight path.’ The phrase ‘civitatem habitationis’ refers to a livable city, unlike the cities of the unbelievers, which are places of desolation for those who believe.

verses.textEn: Let his mercies confess to the Lord, and let his miracles confess to the sons of men.
verses.textLa: Confiteantur Domino misericordiæ eius: et mirabilia eius filiis hominum.

verses.textEn: For he has satisfied the empty soul, and he has satisfied the hungry soul with good things:
verses.textLa: Quia satiavit animam inanem: et animam esurientem satiavit bonis.

verses.textEn: those sitting in darkness and in the shadow of death, shackled by extreme poverty and by iron.
verses.textLa: Sedentes in tenebris, et umbra mortis: vinctos in mendicitate, et ferro.

verses.textEn: For they exasperated the eloquence of God, and they irritated the deliberation of the Most High.
verses.textLa: Quia exacerbaverunt eloquia Dei: et consilium Altissimi irritaverunt.

verses.textEn: And their heart was brought low with hardships. They were weakened, and there was no one to help them.
verses.textLa: Et humiliatum est in laboribus cor eorum: infirmati sunt, nec fuit qui adiuvaret.

verses.textEn: And they cried out to the Lord in their tribulation, and he freed them from their distress.
verses.textLa: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur: et de necessitatibus eorum liberavit eos.

verses.textEn: And he led them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and he broke apart their chains.
verses.textLa: Et eduxit eos de tenebris, et umbra mortis: et vincula eorum dirupit.

verses.textEn: Let his mercies confess to the Lord, and let his miracles confess to the sons of men.
verses.textLa: Confiteantur Domino misericordiæ eius: et mirabilia eius filiis hominum.

verses.textEn: For he has crushed the gates of brass and broken the iron bars.
verses.textLa: Quia contrivit portas æreas: et vectes ferreos confregit.

verses.textEn: He has taken them up, from the way of their iniquity. For they were brought low, because of their injustices.
verses.textLa: Suscepit eos de via iniquitatis eorum: propter iniustitias enim suas humiliati sunt.

verses.textEn: Their soul abhorred all food, and they drew near even to the gates of death.
verses.textLa: Omnem escam abominata est anima eorum: et appropinquaverunt usque ad portas mortis.

verses.textEn: And they cried out to the Lord in their tribulation, and he delivered them in their necessity.
verses.textLa: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur: et de necessitatibus eorum liberavit eos.

verses.textEn: He sent his word, and he healed them, and he rescued them from their utter destruction.
verses.textLa: Misit verbum suum, et sanavit eos: et eripuit eos de interitionibus eorum.

verses.textEn: Let his mercies confess to the Lord, and let his miracles confess to the sons of men.
verses.textLa: Confiteantur Domino misericordiæ eius: et mirabilia eius filiis hominum.

verses.textEn: And let them offer sacrifice with the sacrifice of praise, and let them announce his works in exultation.
verses.textLa: Et sacrificent sacrificium laudis: et annuncient opera eius in exultatione.

verses.textEn: Those who descend to the sea in ships, making their livelihood in the great waters:
verses.textLa: Qui descendunt mare in navibus, facientes operationem in aquis multis.

verses.textEn: these have seen the works of the Lord and his wonders in the deep.
verses.textLa: Ipsi viderunt opera Domini, et mirabilia eius in profundo.

verses.textEn: He spoke: and a windstorm stood up, and its waves were exalted.
verses.textLa: Dixit, et stetit spiritus procellæ: et exaltati sunt fluctus eius.

verses.textEn: They ascend even to the heavens, and they descend even to the abyss. Their soul will waste away in distress.
verses.textLa: Ascendunt usque ad cælos, et descendunt usque ad abyssos: anima eorum in malis tabescebat.

verses.textEn: They were troubled, and they moved like a drunkard, and all their wisdom was consumed.
verses.textLa: Turbati sunt, et moti sunt sicut ebrius: et omnis sapientia eorum devorata est.

verses.textEn: And they cried out to the Lord in their tribulation, and he led them out of their distress.
verses.textLa: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur, et de necessitatibus eorum eduxit eos.

verses.textEn: And he replaced the storm with a breeze, and its waves were stilled.
verses.textLa: Et statuit procellam eius in auram: et siluerunt fluctus eius.

verses.textEn: And they were joyful that it was stilled, and he led them into the haven that they desired.
verses.textLa: Et lætati sunt quia siluerunt: et deduxit eos in portum voluntatis eorum.

verses.textEn: Let his mercies confess to the Lord, and let his miracles confess to the sons of men.
verses.textLa: Confiteantur Domino misericordiæ eius: et mirabilia eius filiis hominum.

verses.textEn: And let them exalt him in the Church of the people, and praise him in the chair of the elders.
verses.textLa: Et exaltent eum in Ecclesia plebis: et in cathedra seniorum laudent eum.

verses.textEn: He has placed rivers in the desert and sources of water in dry places,
verses.textLa: Posuit flumina in desertum: et exitus aquarum in sitim.

verses.textEn: a fruit-bearing land in the midst of brine, before the malice of those who dwell in it.
verses.textLa: Terram fructiferam in salsuginem, a malitia inhabitantium in ea.
verses.notes: The fruitful land in the midst of brine symbolizes the faithful living in the midst of persons of malice.

verses.textEn: He has placed a desert in the midst of pools of waters, and a land without water in the midst of sources of water.
verses.textLa: Posuit desertum in stagna aquarum: et terram sine aqua in exitus aquarum.

verses.textEn: And he has gathered the hungry together there, and they constructed a city of habitation.
verses.textLa: Et collocavit illic esurientes: et constituerunt civitatem habitationis.

verses.textEn: And they sowed fields and planted vineyards, and they produced the fruit of nativity.
verses.textLa: Et seminaverunt agros, et plantaverunt vineas: et fecerunt fructum nativitatis.

verses.textEn: And he blessed them, and they were multiplied exceedingly. And he did not diminish their beasts of burden.
verses.textLa: Et benedixit eis, et multiplicati sunt nimis: et iumenta eorum non minoravit.

verses.textEn: And they became few, and they were afflicted by the tribulation of evils and of sorrow.
verses.textLa: Et pauci facti sunt: et vexati sunt a tribulatione malorum, et dolore.

verses.textEn: Contempt was poured over their leaders, and he caused them to wander in an impassable place, and not on the way.
verses.textLa: Effusa est contemptio super principes: et errare fecit eos in invio, et non in via.

verses.textEn: And he helped the poor out of destitution, and he stationed families like sheep.
verses.textLa: Et adiuvit pauperem de inopia: et posuit sicut oves familias.

verses.textEn: The upright will see, and they will rejoice. And every iniquity will block its mouth.
verses.textLa: Videbunt recti, et lætabuntur: et omnis iniquitas oppilabit os suum.

verses.textEn: Who is wise and will keep these things? And who will understand the mercies of the Lord?
verses.textLa: Quis sapiens et custodiet hæc? et intelliget misericordias Domini?

verses.textEn: A Canticle Psalm, of David himself.
verses.textLa: Canticum Psalmi ipsi David.

verses.textEn: My heart is prepared, O God, my heart is prepared. I will sing songs, and I will sing psalms in my glory.
verses.textLa: Paratum cor meum Deus, paratum cor meum: cantabo, et psallam in gloria mea.

verses.textEn: Rise up, my glory. Rise up, Psalter and harp. I will arise in early morning.
verses.textLa: Exurge gloria mea, exurge psalterium, et cithara: exurgam diluculo.

verses.textEn: I will confess to you, O Lord, among the peoples. And I will sing psalms to you among the nations.
verses.textLa: Confitebor tibi in populis Domine: et psallam tibi in nationibus.

verses.textEn: For your mercy is great, beyond the heavens, and your truth, even to the clouds.
verses.textLa: Quia magna est super cælos misericordia tua: et usque ad nubes veritas tua:

verses.textEn: Be exalted, O God, beyond the heavens, and your glory, beyond all the earth,
verses.textLa: Exaltare super cælos Deus, et super omnem terram gloria tua:

verses.textEn: so that your beloved may be freed. Save with your right hand, and heed me.
verses.textLa: ut liberentur dilecti tui. Salvum fac dextera tua, et exaudi me:

verses.textEn: God has spoken in his holiness. I will exult, and I will divide Shechem, and I will divide by measure the steep valley of tabernacles.
verses.textLa: Deus locutus est in sancto suo: Exultabo, et dividam Sichimam, et convallem tabernaculorum dimetiar.

verses.textEn: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine, and Ephraim is the supporter of my head. Judah is my king.
verses.textLa: Meus est Galaad, et meus est Manasses: et Ephraim susceptio capitis mei. Iuda rex meus:

verses.textEn: Moab is the cooking pot of my hope. I will extend my shoe in Idumea; the foreigners have become my friends.
verses.textLa: Moab lebes spei meæ. In Idumæam extendam calceamentum meum: mihi alienigenæ amici facti sunt.

verses.textEn: Who will lead me into the fortified city? Who will lead me, even into Idumea?
verses.textLa: Quis deducet me in civitatem munitam? quis deducet me usque in Idumæam?

verses.textEn: Will not you, O God, who had rejected us? And will not you, O God, go out with our armies?
verses.textLa: Nonne tu Deus, qui repulisti nos, et non exibis Deus in virtutibus nostris?

verses.textEn: Grant us help from tribulation, for vain is the help of man.
verses.textLa: Da nobis auxilium de tribulatione: quia vana salus hominis.

verses.textEn: In God, we will act virtuously, and he will bring our enemies to nothing.
verses.textLa: In Deo faciemus virtutem: et ipse ad nihilum deducet inimicos nostros.

verses.textEn: Unto the end. A Psalm of David.
verses.textLa: In finem, Psalmus David.

verses.textEn: O God, do not be silent toward my praise, for the mouth of the sinner and the mouth of the deceitful one have been opened against me.
verses.textLa: Deus laudem meam ne tacueris: quia os peccatoris, et os dolosi super me apertum est.

verses.textEn: They have spoken against me with deceitful tongues, and they have surrounded me with hateful words, and they fought against me over nothing.
verses.textLa: Locuti sunt adversum me lingua dolosa, et sermonibus odii circumdederunt me: et expugnaverunt me gratis.

verses.textEn: Instead of choosing to act on my behalf, they detracted me. But I gave myself to prayer.
verses.textLa: Pro eo ut me diligerent, detrahebant mihi: ego autem orabam.
verses.notes: The verb ‘diligerent’ can mean ‘to love,’ but it can also mean ‘to choose.’ In this case, his complaint is not that they don’t love him, but that they do not choose (to act) on his behalf or in his favor.

verses.textEn: And they set evil against me, instead of good, and hatred, in return for my love.
verses.textLa: Et posuerunt adversum me mala pro bonis: et odium pro dilectione mea.

verses.textEn: Establish the sinner over him, and let the devil stand at his right hand.
verses.textLa: Constitue super eum peccatorem: et diabolus stet a dextris eius.

verses.textEn: When he is judged, may he go forth in condemnation, and may his prayer be counted as sin.
verses.textLa: Cum iudicatur, exeat condemnatus: et oratio eius fiat in peccatum.

verses.textEn: May his days be few, and let another take his episcopate.
verses.textLa: Fiant dies eius pauci: et episcopatum eius accipiat alter.
verses.notes: This verse is applied by the Acts of the Apostles to the replacement of Judas Iscariot with Matthias as the twelfth Apostle.

verses.textEn: May his sons be orphans, and his wife a widow.
verses.textLa: Fiant filii eius orphani: et uxor eius vidua.

verses.textEn: May his sons be carried by those who walk unsteadily, and may they go begging. And may they be cast out of their dwelling places.
verses.textLa: Nutantes transferantur filii eius, et mendicent: et eiiciantur de habitationibus suis.
verses.notes: The word ‘Nutantes’ refers to wavering. In other words: may his sons be carried around by those who waver (walk unsteadily).

verses.textEn: May the money lenders scrutinize all his belongings, and let foreigners plunder his labors.
verses.textLa: Scrutetur fœnerator omnem substantiam eius: et diripiant alieni labores eius.

verses.textEn: May there be no one to assist him, nor anyone to be compassionate to his orphaned children.
verses.textLa: Non sit illi adiutor: nec sit qui misereatur pupillis eius.

verses.textEn: May his posterity be in utter ruin. In one generation, may his name be wiped away.
verses.textLa: Fiant nati eius in interitum: in generatione una deleatur nomen eius.

verses.textEn: May the iniquity of his fathers return in memory before the sight of the Lord, and do not let the sin of his mother be wiped away.
verses.textLa: In memoriam redeat iniquitas patrum eius in conspectu Domini: et peccatum matris eius non deleatur.

verses.textEn: May these be opposite the Lord always, but let their memory perish from the earth.
verses.textLa: Fiant contra Dominum semper, et dispereat de terra memoria eorum:

verses.textEn: For certain things are not remembered about them, in order to be merciful.
verses.textLa: pro eo quod non est recordatus facere misericordiam.
verses.notes: This verse is more accurately translated loosely. It explains the previous verses, which say that these evil doers will be forgotten through all the earth, but not by God. Their evil deeds will not be remembered for the sake of mercy. The subsequent verses detail some of those evil deeds.

verses.textEn: And so the destitute man was pursued, with the beggar and the remorseful in heart, so as to be put to death.
verses.textLa: Et persecutus est hominem inopem, et mendicum, et compunctum corde mortificare.

verses.textEn: And he loved a curse, and it came to him. And he was unwilling to have a blessing, and it went far from him. And he clothed himself with curses like a garment, and it entered his inner self like water, and it entered his bones like oil.
verses.textLa: Et dilexit maledictionem, et veniet ei: et noluit benedictionem, et elongabitur ab eo. Et induit maledictionem sicut vestimentum, et intravit sicut aqua in interiora eius, et sicut oleum in ossibus eius.

verses.textEn: May it be to him like a garment that covers him, and like a belt that always cinches him.
verses.textLa: Fiat ei sicut vestimentum, quo operitur: et sicut zona, qua semper præcingitur.

verses.textEn: This is the work of those who detract me with the Lord and who speak evils against my soul.
verses.textLa: Hoc opus eorum, qui detrahunt mihi apud Dominum: et qui loquuntur mala adversus animam meam.

verses.textEn: But as for you, Lord, O Lord: act on my behalf for your name’s sake. For your mercy is sweet.
verses.textLa: Et tu Domine, Domine, fac mecum propter nomen tuum: quia suavis est misericordia tua.

verses.textEn: Free me, for I am destitute and poor, and my heart has been disquieted within me.
verses.textLa: Libera me quia egenus, et pauper ego sum: et cor meum conturbatum est intra me.

verses.textEn: I have been taken away like a shadow when it declines, and I have been shaken off like locusts.
verses.textLa: Sicut umbra cum declinat, ablatus sum: et excussus sum sicut locustæ.

verses.textEn: My knees have been weakened by fasting, and my flesh has been replaced by oil.
verses.textLa: Genua mea infirmata sunt a ieiunio: et caro mea immutata est propter oleum.

verses.textEn: And I have become a disgrace to them. They saw me, and they shook their heads.
verses.textLa: Et ego factus sum opprobrium illis: viderunt me, et moverunt capita sua.

verses.textEn: Help me, O Lord, my God. Save me according to your mercy.
verses.textLa: Adiuva me Domine Deus meus: salvum me fac secundum misericordiam tuam.

verses.textEn: And let them know that this is your hand, and that you, O Lord, have done this.
verses.textLa: Et sciant quia manus tua hæc: et tu Domine fecisti eam.

verses.textEn: They will curse, and you will bless. May those who rise up against me be confounded. But your servant will rejoice.
verses.textLa: Maledicent illi, et tu benedices: qui insurgunt in me, confundantur: servus autem tuus lætabitur.

verses.textEn: May those who detract me be clothed with shame, and may they be covered with their confusion, as if with a double cloak.
verses.textLa: Induantur qui detrahunt mihi, pudore: et operiantur sicut diploide confusione sua.

verses.textEn: I will confess exceedingly to the Lord with my mouth. And I will praise him in the midst of the multitude.
verses.textLa: Confitebor Domino nimis in ore meo: et in medio multorum laudabo eum.

verses.textEn: For he stands at the right hand of the poor, in order to save my soul from persecutors.
verses.textLa: Quia astitit a dextris pauperis, ut salvam faceret a persequentibus animam meam.

verses.textEn: A Psalm of David. The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool.”
verses.textLa: Psalmus David. Dixit Dominus Domino meo: Sede a dextris meis: Donec ponam inimicos tuos, scabellum pedum tuorum.

verses.textEn: The Lord will send forth the scepter of your virtue from Zion. Rule in the midst of your enemies.
verses.textLa: Virgam virtutis tuæ emittet Dominus ex Sion: dominare in medio inimicorum tuorum.

verses.textEn: It is with you from the beginning, in the day of your virtue, in the splendor of the saints. From conception, before the light-bearer, I begot you.
verses.textLa: Tecum principium in die virtutis tuæ in splendoribus sanctorum: ex utero ante luciferum genui te.
verses.notes: The phrase ‘ante luciferum’ has a level of meaning whereby it refers to Lucifer, the devil. The meaning here is that God’s only Son was begotten in eternity, before the Angels were created, before the Angels fell from grace, before Lucifer (the light-bearer) became Satan (the adversary). The phrase ‘ex utero’ does not mean ‘from the womb,’ but has more of the meaning of ‘from conception.’ The word ‘utero’ is often used in Latin to refer to the generative capability (the ability to bring about conception) of men and women. In this case, it refers to the generative capability of the Father to give rise to the Son by procession.

verses.textEn: The Lord has sworn, and he will not repent: “You are a priest forever, according to the order of Melchizedek.”
verses.textLa: Iuravit Dominus, et non pœnitebit eum: Tu es sacerdos in æternum secundum ordinem Melchisedech.

verses.textEn: The Lord is at your right hand. He has broken kings in the day of his wrath.
verses.textLa: Dominus a dextris tuis, confregit in die iræ suæ reges.

verses.textEn: He will judge between the nations; he will fill up ruination. He will shatter heads in the land of the many.
verses.textLa: Iudicabit in nationibus, implebit ruinas: conquassabit capita in terra multorum.

verses.textEn: He will drink from the torrent on the way. Because of this, he will exalt the head.
verses.textLa: De torrente in via bibet: propterea exaltabit caput.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. I will confess to you, O Lord, with my whole heart, in the council of the just and in the congregation.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Confitebor tibi Domine in toto corde meo: in consilio iustorum, et congregatione.

verses.textEn: Great are the works of the Lord, exquisite in all his intentions.
verses.textLa: Magna opera Domini: exquisita in omnes voluntates eius.

verses.textEn: Confession and magnificence are his work. And his justice remains from age to age.
verses.textLa: Confessio et magnificentia opus eius: et iustitia eius manet in sæculum sæculi.

verses.textEn: He has created a memorial to his wonders; he is a merciful and compassionate Lord.
verses.textLa: Memoriam fecit mirabilium suorum, misericors et miserator Dominus:

verses.textEn: He has given food to those who fear him. He will be mindful of his covenant in every age.
verses.textLa: escam dedit timentibus se. Memor erit in sæculum testamenti sui:

verses.textEn: He will announce the virtue of his works to his people,
verses.textLa: virtutem operum suorum annunciabit populo suo:

verses.textEn: so that he may give them the inheritance of the nations. The works of his hands are truth and judgment.
verses.textLa: Ut det illis hereditatem gentium: opera manuum eius veritas, et iudicium.

verses.textEn: All his commands are faithful: confirmed from age to age, created in truth and fairness.
verses.textLa: Fidelia omnia mandata eius: confirmata in sæculum sæculi, facta in veritate et æquitate.

verses.textEn: He has sent redemption upon his people. He has commanded his covenant for all eternity. Holy and terrible is his name.
verses.textLa: Redemptionem misit populo suo: mandavit in æternum testamentum suum. Sanctum, et terribile nomen eius:

verses.textEn: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. A good understanding is for all who do it. His praise remains from age to age.
verses.textLa: initium sapientiæ timor Domini. Intellectus bonus omnibus facientibus eum: laudatio eius manet in sæculum sæculi.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Of the return of Haggai and Zachariah. Blessed is the man who fears the Lord. He will prefer his commandments exceedingly.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Reversionis Aggæi, et Zachariæ. Beatus vir, qui timet Dominum: in mandatis eius volet nimis.

verses.textEn: His offspring will be powerful on the earth. The generation of the upright will be blessed.
verses.textLa: Potens in terra erit semen eius: generatio rectorum benedicetur.

verses.textEn: Glory and wealth will be in his house, and his justice shall remain from age to age.
verses.textLa: Gloria, et divitiæ in domo eius: et iustitia eius manet in sæculum sæculi.

verses.textEn: For the upright, a light has risen up in the darkness. He is merciful and compassionate and just.
verses.textLa: Exortum est in tenebris lumen rectis: misericors, et miserator, et iustus.

verses.textEn: Pleasing is the man who shows mercy and lends. He will order his words with judgment.
verses.textLa: Iucundus homo qui miseretur et commodat, disponet sermones suos in iudicio:

verses.textEn: For he will not be disturbed in eternity.
verses.textLa: quia in æternum non commovebitur.

verses.textEn: The just one will be an everlasting memorial. He will not fear a report of disasters. His heart is prepared to hope in the Lord.
verses.textLa: In memoria æterna erit iustus: ab auditione mala non timebit. Paratum cor eius sperare in Domino,

verses.textEn: His heart has been confirmed. He will not be disturbed, until he looks down upon his enemies.
verses.textLa: confirmatum est cor eius: non commovebitur donec despiciat inimicos suos.

verses.textEn: He has distributed, he has given to the poor. His justice shall remain from age to age. His horn shall be exalted in glory.
verses.textLa: Dispersit, dedit pauperibus: iustitia eius manet in sæculum sæculi, cornu eius exaltabitur in gloria.

verses.textEn: The sinner will see and become angry. He will gnash his teeth and waste away. The desire of sinners will perish.
verses.textLa: Peccator videbit, et irascetur, dentibus suis fremet et tabescet: desiderium peccatorum peribit.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Praise the Lord, children. Praise the name of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Laudate pueri Dominum: laudate nomen Domini.

verses.textEn: Blessed is the name of the Lord, from this time forward and even forever.
verses.textLa: Sit nomen Domini benedictum, ex hoc nunc, et usque in sæculum.

verses.textEn: From the rising of the sun, even to its setting, praiseworthy is the name of the Lord.
verses.textLa: A solis ortu usque ad occasum, laudabile nomen Domini.

verses.textEn: The Lord is high above all nations, and his glory is high above the heavens.
verses.textLa: Excelsus super omnes gentes Dominus, et super cælos gloria eius.

verses.textEn: Who is like the Lord, our God, who dwells on high,
verses.textLa: Quis sicut Dominus Deus noster, qui in altis habitat,

verses.textEn: and who gazes upon the humble things in heaven and on earth?
verses.textLa: et humilia respicit in cælo et in terra?

verses.textEn: He lifts up the needy from the ground, and he urges the poor away from filth,
verses.textLa: Suscitans a terra inopem, et de stercore erigens pauperem:

verses.textEn: so that he may place him with the leaders, with the leaders of his people.
verses.textLa: Ut collocet eum cum principibus, cum principibus populi sui.

verses.textEn: He causes a barren woman to live in a house, as the joyful mother of sons.
verses.textLa: Qui habitare facit sterilem in domo, matrem filiorum lætantem.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. At the departure of Israel from Egypt, the house of Jacob from a barbarous people:
verses.textLa: Alleluia. In exitu Israel de Ægypto, domus Iacob de populo barbaro:

verses.textEn: Judea was made his sanctuary; Israel was made his power.
verses.textLa: Facta est Iudæa sanctificatio eius, Israel potestas eius.

verses.textEn: The sea looked, and it fled. The Jordan was turned back again.
verses.textLa: Mare vidit, et fugit: Iordanis conversus est retrorsum.

verses.textEn: The mountains exulted like rams, and the hills like lambs among the sheep.
verses.textLa: Montes exultaverunt ut arietes: et colles sicut agni ovium.
verses.notes: The genitive case does not always translate as ‘of,’ nor does it always connotate possession. It can also translate as ‘among.’

verses.textEn: What happened to you, O sea, so that you fled, and to you, O Jordan, so that you were turned back again?
verses.textLa: Quid est tibi mare quod fugisti: et tu Iordanis, quia conversus es retrorsum?

verses.textEn: What happened to you, O mountains, so that you exulted like rams, and to you, O hills, so that you exulted like lambs among the sheep?
verses.textLa: Montes exultastis sicut arietes, et colles sicut agni ovium?

verses.textEn: Before the face of the Lord, the earth was moved, before the face of the God of Jacob.
verses.textLa: A facie Domini mota est terra, a facie Dei Iacob.

verses.textEn: He converted the rock into pools of water, and the cliff into fountains of waters.
verses.textLa: Qui convertit petram in stagna aquarum, et rupem in fontes aquarum.

verses.textEn: Not to us, O Lord, not to us, but to your name give glory.
verses.textLa: Non nobis Domine, non nobis: sed nomini tuo da gloriam.

verses.textEn: Give glory to your mercy and your truth, lest the Gentiles should say, “Where is their God?”
verses.textLa: Super misericordia tua, et veritate tua: nequando dicant Gentes: Ubi est Deus eorum?
verses.notes: The verb here is implied from the previous verse.

verses.textEn: But our God is in heaven. All things whatsoever that he has willed, he has done.
verses.textLa: Deus autem noster in cælo: omnia quæcumque voluit, fecit.

verses.textEn: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the works of the hands of men.
verses.textLa: Simulacra gentium argentum, et aurum, opera manuum hominum.

verses.textEn: They have mouths, and do not speak; they have eyes, and do not see.
verses.textLa: Os habent, et non loquentur: oculos habent, et non videbunt.

verses.textEn: They have ears, and do not hear; they have noses, and do not smell.
verses.textLa: Aures habent, et non audient: nares habent, et non odorabunt.

verses.textEn: They have hands, and do not feel; they have feet, and do not walk. Neither will they cry out with their throat.
verses.textLa: Manus habent, et non palpabunt: pedes habent, et non ambulabunt: non clamabunt in gutture suo.

verses.textEn: Let those who make them become like them, along with all who trust in them.
verses.textLa: Similes illis fiant qui faciunt ea: et omnes qui confidunt in eis.

verses.textEn: The house of Israel has hoped in the Lord. He is their helper and their protector.
verses.textLa: Domus Israel speravit in Domino: adiutor eorum et protector eorum est.

verses.textEn: The house of Aaron has hoped in the Lord. He is their helper and their protector.
verses.textLa: Domus Aaron speravit in Domino: adiutor eorum et protector eorum est.

verses.textEn: Those who fear the Lord have hoped in the Lord. He is their helper and their protector.
verses.textLa: Qui timent Dominum, speraverunt in Domino: adiutor eorum et protector eorum est.

verses.textEn: The Lord has been mindful of us, and he has blessed us. He has blessed the house of Israel. He has blessed the house of Aaron.
verses.textLa: Dominus memor fuit nostri: et benedixit nobis: Benedixit domui Israel: benedixit domui Aaron.

verses.textEn: He has blessed all who fear the Lord, the small with the great.
verses.textLa: Benedixit omnibus, qui timent Dominum, pusillis cum maioribus.

verses.textEn: May the Lord add blessings upon you: upon you, and upon your sons.
verses.textLa: Adiiciat Dominus super vos: super vos, et super filios vestros.

verses.textEn: Blessed are you by the Lord, who made heaven and earth.
verses.textLa: Benedicti vos a Domino, qui fecit cælum, et terram.

verses.textEn: The heaven of heaven is for the Lord, but the earth he has given to the sons of men.
verses.textLa: Cælum cæli Domino: terram autem dedit filiis hominum.

verses.textEn: The dead will not praise you, Lord, and neither will all those who descend into Hell.
verses.textLa: Non mortui laudabunt te Domine: neque omnes, qui descendunt in infernum.

verses.textEn: But we who live will bless the Lord, from this time forward, and even forever.
verses.textLa: Sed nos qui vivimus, benedicimus Domino, ex hoc nunc et usque in sæculum.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. I have loved: therefore, the Lord will heed the voice of my prayer.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Dilexi, quoniam exaudiet Dominus vocem orationis meæ.
verses.notes: In this case, ‘quoniam’ does not mean ‘because,’ but more like ‘therefore.’ Here is a common translation problem. A Latin word is very often translated, and properly so, by one particular English word. Then along comes a context in which that Latin word actually means something else. It should be translated in this other context by another English word. But it is a common translation mistake not to do so. In this verse, the statement ‘I have loved,’ is followed, not by the reason that I loved, but by the result of that choice. I do not choose to love because I think that God will answer my prayers, but rather when I choose to love, the result is that God will answer my prayers.

verses.textEn: For he has inclined his ear to me. And in my days, I will call upon him.
verses.textLa: Quia inclinavit aurem suam mihi: et in diebus meis invocabo.

verses.textEn: The sorrows of death have surrounded me, and the perils of Hell have found me. I have found tribulation and sorrow.
verses.textLa: Circumdederunt me dolores mortis: et pericula inferni invenerunt me. Tribulationem et dolorem inveni:

verses.textEn: And so, I called upon the name of the Lord. O Lord, free my soul.
verses.textLa: et nomen Domini invocavi. O Domine libera animam meam:

verses.textEn: Merciful is the Lord, and just. And our God is compassionate.
verses.textLa: misericors Dominus, et iustus: et Deus noster miseretur.

verses.textEn: The Lord is the keeper of little ones. I was humbled, and he freed me.
verses.textLa: Custodiens parvulos Dominus: humiliatus sum, et liberavit me.

verses.textEn: Turn again, my soul, to your rest. For the Lord has done good to you.
verses.textLa: Convertere anima mea in requiem tuam: quia Dominus benefecit tibi.

verses.textEn: For he has rescued my soul from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from slipping.
verses.textLa: Quia eripuit animam meam de morte: oculos meos a lacrymis, pedes meos a lapsu.

verses.textEn: I will please the Lord in the land of the living.
verses.textLa: Placebo Domino in regione vivorum.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. I had confidence, because of what I was saying, but then I was greatly humbled.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Credidi, propter quod locutus sum: ego autem humiliatus sum nimis.

verses.textEn: I said in my excess, “Every man is a liar.”
verses.textLa: Ego dixi in excessu meo: Omnis homo mendax.

verses.textEn: What shall I repay to the Lord, for all the things that he has repaid to me?
verses.textLa: Quid retribuam Domino, pro omnibus, quæ retribuit mihi?

verses.textEn: I will take up the cup of salvation, and I will call upon the name of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Calicem salutaris accipiam: et nomen Domini invocabo.

verses.textEn: I will repay my vows to the Lord, in the sight of all his people.
verses.textLa: Vota mea Domino reddam coram omni populo eius:

verses.textEn: Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his holy ones.
verses.textLa: pretiosa in conspectu Domini mors sanctorum eius:

verses.textEn: O Lord, because I am your servant, your servant and the son of your handmaid, you have broken my bonds.
verses.textLa: O Domine quia ego servus tuus: ego servus tuus, et filius ancillæ tuæ. Dirupisti vincula mea:

verses.textEn: I will sacrifice to you the sacrifice of praise, and I will invoke the name of the Lord.
verses.textLa: tibi sacrificabo hostiam laudis, et nomen Domini invocabo.

verses.textEn: I will repay my vows to the Lord in the sight of all his people,
verses.textLa: Vota mea Domino reddam in conspectu omnis populi eius:

verses.textEn: in the courts of the house of the Lord, in your midst, O Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: in atriis domus Domini, in medio tui Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. All nations, praise the Lord. All peoples, praise him.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Laudate Dominum omnes Gentes: laudate eum omnes populi:

verses.textEn: For his mercy has been confirmed over us. And the truth of the Lord remains for all eternity.
verses.textLa: Quoniam confirmata est super nos misericordia eius: et veritas Domini manet in æternum.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Confess to the Lord, for he is good, for his mercy is forever.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Confitemini Domino quoniam bonus: quoniam in sæculum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Let Israel now say: For he is good, for his mercy is forever.
verses.textLa: Dicat nunc Israel quoniam bonus: quoniam in sæculum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Let the house of Aaron now say: For his mercy is forever.
verses.textLa: Dicat nunc domus Aaron: quoniam in sæculum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Let those who fear the Lord now say: For his mercy is forever.
verses.textLa: Dicant nunc qui timent Dominum: quoniam in sæculum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: In my tribulation, I called upon the Lord. And the Lord heeded me with generosity.
verses.textLa: De tribulatione invocavi Dominum: et exaudivit me in latitudine Dominus.

verses.textEn: The Lord is my helper. I will not fear what man can do to me.
verses.textLa: Dominus mihi adiutor: non timebo quid faciat mihi homo.

verses.textEn: The Lord is my helper. And I will look down upon my enemies.
verses.textLa: Dominus mihi adiutor: et ego despiciam inimicos meos.

verses.textEn: It is good to trust in the Lord, rather than to trust in man.
verses.textLa: Bonum est confidere in Domino, quam confidere in homine:

verses.textEn: It is good to hope in the Lord, rather than to hope in leaders.
verses.textLa: Bonum est sperare in Domino, quam sperare in principibus.

verses.textEn: All the nations have surrounded me. And, in the name of the Lord, I have been avenged over them.
verses.textLa: Omnes gentes circuierunt me: et in nomine Domini quia ultus sum in eos.

verses.textEn: Surrounding me, they closed in on me. And, in the name of the Lord, I have been avenged over them.
verses.textLa: Circumdantes circumdederunt me: et in nomine Domini quia ultus sum in eos.

verses.textEn: They surrounded me like a swarm, and they burned like fire among the thorns. And, in the name of the Lord, I have been avenged over them.
verses.textLa: Circumdederunt me sicut apes, et exarserunt sicut ignis in spinis: et in nomine Domini quia ultus sum in eos.

verses.textEn: Having been pushed, I was overturned so as to fall. But the Lord took me up.
verses.textLa: Impulsus eversus sum ut caderem: et Dominus suscepit me.

verses.textEn: The Lord is my strength and my praise. And he has become my salvation.
verses.textLa: Fortitudo mea, et laus mea Dominus: et factus est mihi in salutem.

verses.textEn: A voice of exultation and salvation is in the tabernacles of the just.
verses.textLa: Vox exultationis, et salutis in tabernaculis iustorum.

verses.textEn: The right hand of the Lord has wrought virtue. The right hand of the Lord has exalted me. The right hand of the Lord has wrought virtue.
verses.textLa: Dextera Domini fecit virtutem: dextera Domini exaltavit me, dextera Domini fecit virtutem.

verses.textEn: I will not die, but I will live. And I will declare the works of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Non moriar, sed vivam: et narrabo opera Domini.

verses.textEn: When chastising, the Lord chastised me. But he has not delivered me over to death.
verses.textLa: Castigans castigavit me Dominus: et morti non tradidit me.

verses.textEn: Open the gates of justice to me. I will enter them, and I will confess to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Aperite mihi portas iustitiæ, ingressus in eas confitebor Domino:

verses.textEn: This is the gate of the Lord. The just will enter by it.
verses.textLa: hæc porta Domini, iusti intrabunt in eam.

verses.textEn: I will confess to you because you have heard me. And you have become my salvation.
verses.textLa: Confitebor tibi quoniam exaudisti me: et factus es mihi in salutem.

verses.textEn: The stone which the builders have rejected, this has become the head of the corner.
verses.textLa: Lapidem, quem reprobaverunt ædificantes: hic factus est in caput anguli.
verses.notes: The Latin phrase translated as ‘head of the corner’ is a Latin translation of the same Hebrew expression. It is a fitting description of Christ, since He is the Head of all Creation. It can also be translated as ‘cornerstone.’

verses.textEn: By the Lord has this been done, and it is a wonder before our eyes.
verses.textLa: A Domino factum est istud: et est mirabile in oculis nostris.

verses.textEn: This is the day that the Lord has made. Let us exult and rejoice in it.
verses.textLa: Hæc est dies, quam fecit Dominus: exultemus, et lætemur in ea.

verses.textEn: O Lord, grant salvation to me. O Lord, grant good prosperity.
verses.textLa: O Domine salvum me fac: O Domine bene prosperare:

verses.textEn: Blessed is he who arrives in the name of the Lord. We have blessed you from the house of the Lord.
verses.textLa: benedictus qui venit in nomine Domini. Benediximus vobis de domo Domini:

verses.textEn: The Lord is God, and he has enlightened us. Establish a solemn day amid a dense crowd, even to the horn of the altar.
verses.textLa: Deus Dominus, et illuxit nobis. Constituite diem solemnem in condensis, usque ad cornu altaris.
verses.notes: The word ‘condensis’ often refers to a dense thicket of woods. However, in this context (of something dense like a thicket of trees that reaches even to the altar) the meaning is clearly of a thick crowd attending a solemn ceremony.

verses.textEn: You are my God, and I will confess to you. You are my God, and I will exalt you. I will confess to you, for you have heeded me. And you have become my salvation.
verses.textLa: Deus meus es tu, et confitebor tibi: Deus meus es tu, et exaltabo te. Confitebor tibi quoniam exaudisti me: et factus es mihi in salutem.

verses.textEn: Confess to the Lord, for he is good, for his mercy is forever.
verses.textLa: Confitemini Domino quoniam bonus: quoniam in sæculum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. ALEPH. Blessed are the immaculate in the way, who walk in the law of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. ALEPH. Beati immaculati in via: qui ambulant in lege Domini.

verses.textEn: Blessed are those who examine his testimonies. They seek him with their whole heart.
verses.textLa: Beati, qui scrutantur testimonia eius: in toto corde exquirunt eum.

verses.textEn: For those who work iniquity have not walked in his ways.
verses.textLa: Non enim qui operantur iniquitatem, in viis eius ambulaverunt.

verses.textEn: You have ordered your commandments to be kept most diligently.
verses.textLa: Tu mandasti mandata tua custodiri nimis.

verses.textEn: I wish that my ways may be directed so as to keep your justifications.
verses.textLa: Utinam dirigantur viæ meæ, ad custodiendas iustificationes tuas.

verses.textEn: Then I will not be confounded, when I will look into all your commandments.
verses.textLa: Tunc non confundar, cum perspexero in omnibus mandatis tuis.

verses.textEn: I will confess to you with honesty of heart. In this way, I have learned the judgments of your justice.
verses.textLa: Confitebor tibi in directione cordis: in eo quod didici iudicia iustitiæ tuæ.

verses.textEn: I will keep your justifications. Do not utterly abandon me.
verses.textLa: Iustificationes tuas custodiam: non me derelinquas usquequaque.

verses.textEn: BETH. By what does an adolescent correct his way? By keeping to your words.
verses.textLa: BETH. In quo corrigit adolescentior viam suam? in custodiendo sermones tuos.

verses.textEn: With my whole heart, I have sought you. Do not let me be driven away from your commandments.
verses.textLa: In toto corde meo exquisivi te: ne repellas me a mandatis tuis.

verses.textEn: I have hidden your eloquence in my heart, so that I may not sin against you.
verses.textLa: In corde meo abscondi eloquia tua: ut non peccem tibi.

verses.textEn: Blessed are you, O Lord. Teach me your justifications.
verses.textLa: Benedictus es Domine: doce me iustificationes tuas.

verses.textEn: With my lips, I have pronounced all the judgments of your mouth.
verses.textLa: In labiis meis, pronunciavi omnia iudicia oris tui.

verses.textEn: I have been delighted in the way of your testimonies, as if in all riches.
verses.textLa: In via testimoniorum tuorum delectatus sum, sicut in omnibus divitiis.

verses.textEn: I will be trained in your commandments, and I will consider your ways.
verses.textLa: In mandatis tuis exercebor: et considerabo vias tuas.

verses.textEn: I will meditate on your justifications. I will not forget your words.
verses.textLa: In iustificationibus tuis meditabor: non obliviscar sermones tuos.

verses.textEn: GHIMEL. Repay your servant, revive me; and I will keep your words.
verses.textLa: GHIMEL. Retribue servo tuo, vivifica me: et custodiam sermones tuos.

verses.textEn: Reveal to my eyes, and I will consider the wonders of your law.
verses.textLa: Revela oculos meos: et considerabo mirabilia de lege tua.

verses.textEn: I am a sojourner on the earth. Do not hide your commandments from me.
verses.textLa: Incola ego sum in terra: non abscondas a me mandata tua.

verses.textEn: My soul has longed to desire your justifications at all times.
verses.textLa: Concupivit anima mea desiderare iustificationes tuas, in omni tempore.

verses.textEn: You have rebuked the arrogant. Those who decline from your commandments are accursed.
verses.textLa: Increpasti superbos: maledicti qui declinant a mandatis tuis.

verses.textEn: Take me away from disgrace and contempt, for I have sought your testimonies.
verses.textLa: Aufer a me opprobrium, et contemptum: quia testimonia tua exquisivi.

verses.textEn: For even the leaders sat and spoke against me. But your servant has been trained in your justifications.
verses.textLa: Etenim sederunt principes, et adversum me loquebantur: servus autem tuus exercebatur in iustificationibus tuis.

verses.textEn: For your testimonies are also my meditation, and your justifications are my counsel.
verses.textLa: Nam et testimonia tua meditatio mea est: et consilium meum iustificationes tuæ.

verses.textEn: DALETH. My soul has adhered to the pavement. Revive me according to your word.
verses.textLa: DALETH. Adhæsit pavimento anima mea: vivifica me secundum verbum tuum.

verses.textEn: I have declared my ways, and you have heeded me. Teach me your justifications.
verses.textLa: Vias meas enunciavi, et exaudisti me: doce me iustificationes tuas.

verses.textEn: Instruct me in the way of your justifications, and I will be trained in your wonders.
verses.textLa: Viam iustificationum tuarum instrue me: et exercebor in mirabilibus tuis.

verses.textEn: My soul has slumbered because of weariness. Confirm me in your words.
verses.textLa: Dormitavit anima mea præ tædio: confirma me in verbis tuis.

verses.textEn: Remove the way of iniquity from me, and have mercy on me by your law.
verses.textLa: Viam iniquitatis amove a me: et de lege tua miserere mei.

verses.textEn: I have chosen the way of truth. I have not forgotten your judgments.
verses.textLa: Viam veritatis elegi: iudicia tua non sum oblitus.

verses.textEn: I have adhered to your testimonies, O Lord. Do not be willing to confound me.
verses.textLa: Adhæsi testimoniis tuis Domine: noli me confundere.

verses.textEn: I have run by way of your commandments, when you enlarged my heart.
verses.textLa: Viam mandatorum tuorum cucurri, cum dilatasti cor meum.

verses.textEn: HE. O Lord, place the law before me, the way of your justifications, and I will always inquire into it.
verses.textLa: HE. Legem pone mihi Domine viam iustificationum tuarum: et exquiram eam semper.

verses.textEn: Give me understanding, and I will examine your law. And I will keep it with my whole heart.
verses.textLa: Da mihi intellectum, et scrutabor legem tuam: et custodiam illam in toto corde meo.

verses.textEn: Lead me according to the path of your commandments, for I have desired this.
verses.textLa: Deduc me in semitam mandatorum tuorum: quia ipsam volui.

verses.textEn: Bend my heart with your testimonies, and not with avarice.
verses.textLa: Inclina cor meum in testimonia tua: et non in avaritiam.

verses.textEn: Turn my eyes away, lest they see what is vain. Revive me in your way.
verses.textLa: Averte oculos meos ne videant vanitatem: in via tua vivifica me.

verses.textEn: Station your eloquence with your servant, along with your fear.
verses.textLa: Statue servo tuo eloquium tuum, in timore tuo.

verses.textEn: Cut off my disgrace, which I have taken up, for your judgments are delightful.
verses.textLa: Amputa opprobrium meum, quod suspicatus sum: quia iudicia tua iucunda.

verses.textEn: Behold, I have longed for your commandments. Revive me in your fairness.
verses.textLa: Ecce concupivi mandata tua: in æquitate tua vivifica me.

verses.textEn: VAU. And let your mercy overwhelm me, O Lord: your salvation according to your eloquence.
verses.textLa: VAU. Et veniat super me misericordia tua Domine: salutare tuum secundum eloquium tuum.

verses.textEn: And I will respond to those who reproach me by word, for I have hoped in your words.
verses.textLa: Et respondebo exprobrantibus mihi verbum: quia speravi in sermonibus tuis.

verses.textEn: And do not utterly take away the word of truth from my mouth. For in your judgments, I have hoped beyond hope.
verses.textLa: Et ne auferas de ore meo verbum veritatis usquequaque: quia in iudiciis tuis supersperavi.
verses.notes: The word ‘supersperavi’ uses the prefix ‘super’ to intensify the verb. This could also be translated as ‘I have hoped beyond,’ or, ‘I have greatly hoped.’

verses.textEn: And I will always keep your law, in this age and forever and ever.
verses.textLa: Et custodiam legem tuam semper: in sæculum et in sæculum sæculi.

verses.textEn: And I have wandered far and wide, because I was seeking your commandments.
verses.textLa: Et ambulabam in latitudine: quia mandata tua exquisivi.

verses.textEn: And I spoke of your testimonies in the sight of kings, and I was not confounded.
verses.textLa: Et loquebar in testimoniis tuis in conspectu regum: et non confundebar.

verses.textEn: And I meditated on your commandments, which I loved.
verses.textLa: Et meditabar in mandatis tuis, quæ dilexi.

verses.textEn: And I lifted up my hands to your commandments, which I loved. And I was trained in your justifications.
verses.textLa: Et levavi manus meas ad mandata tua, quæ dilexi: et exercebar in iustificationibus tuis.

verses.textEn: ZAIN. Be mindful of your word to your servant, by which you have given me hope.
verses.textLa: ZAIN. Memor esto verbi tui servo tuo, in quo mihi spem dedisti.

verses.textEn: This has consoled me in my humiliation, for your word has revived me.
verses.textLa: Hæc me consolata est in humilitate mea: quia eloquium tuum vivificavit me.

verses.textEn: The arrogant act altogether iniquitously, but I have not turned aside from your law.
verses.textLa: Superbi inique agebant usquequaque: a lege autem tua non declinavi.

verses.textEn: I called to mind your judgments of antiquity, O Lord, and I was consoled.
verses.textLa: Memor fui iudiciorum tuorum a sæculo Domine: et consolatus sum.

verses.textEn: Faintness has taken hold of me, because of the sinners, those who abandon your law.
verses.textLa: Defectio tenuit me, pro peccatoribus derelinquentibus legem tuam.

verses.textEn: Your justifications were the subject of my worthy singing, in the place of my pilgrimage.
verses.textLa: Cantabiles mihi erant iustificationes tuæ, in loco peregrinationis meæ.

verses.textEn: During the night, I remembered your name, O Lord, and I kept your law.
verses.textLa: Memor fui nocte nominis tui Domine: et custodivi legem tuam.

verses.textEn: This has happened to me because I sought your justifications.
verses.textLa: Hæc facta est mihi: quia iustificationes tuas exquisivi.

verses.textEn: HETH. O Lord, my portion, I have said that I would keep your law.
verses.textLa: HETH. Portio mea Domine, dixi custodire legem tuam.

verses.textEn: I have beseeched your face with my whole heart. Be merciful to me according to your word.
verses.textLa: Deprecatus sum faciem tuam in toto corde meo: miserere mei secundum eloquium tuum.

verses.textEn: I have considered my ways, and I have turned my feet toward your testimonies.
verses.textLa: Cogitavi vias meas: et converti pedes meos in testimonia tua.

verses.textEn: I have been prepared, and I have not been disturbed, so that I may keep your commandments.
verses.textLa: Paratus sum, et non sum turbatus: ut custodiam mandata tua.

verses.textEn: The ropes of the impious have encircled me, and I have not forgotten your law.
verses.textLa: Funes peccatorum circumplexi sunt me: et legem tuam non sum oblitus.

verses.textEn: I arose in the middle of the night to confess to you, over the judgments of your justification.
verses.textLa: Media nocte surgebam ad confitendum tibi, super iudicia iustificationis tuæ.
