verses.textEn: I am a partaker with all those who fear you and who keep your commandments.
verses.textLa: Particeps ego sum omnium timentium te: et custodientium mandata tua.

verses.textEn: The earth, O Lord, is full of your mercy. Teach me your justifications.
verses.textLa: Misericordia tua Domine plena est terra: iustificationes tuas doce me.

verses.textEn: TETH. You have done well with your servant, O Lord, according to your word.
verses.textLa: TETH. Bonitatem fecisti cum servo tuo Domine, secundum verbum tuum.

verses.textEn: Teach me goodness and discipline and knowledge, for I have trusted your commandments.
verses.textLa: Bonitatem, et disciplinam, et scientiam doce me: quia mandatis tuis credidi.

verses.textEn: Before I was humbled, I committed offenses; because of this, I have kept to your word.
verses.textLa: Priusquam humiliarer ego deliqui: propterea eloquium tuum custodivi.

verses.textEn: You are good, so in your goodness teach me your justifications.
verses.textLa: Bonus es tu: et in bonitate tua doce me iustificationes tuas.

verses.textEn: The iniquity of the arrogant has been multiplied over me. Yet I will examine your commandments with all my heart.
verses.textLa: Multiplicata est super me iniquitas superborum: ego autem in toto corde meo scrutabor mandata tua.

verses.textEn: Their heart has been curdled like milk. Truly, I have meditated on your law.
verses.textLa: Coagulatum est sicut lac cor eorum: ego vero legem tuam meditatus sum.

verses.textEn: It is good for me that you humbled me, so that I may learn your justifications.
verses.textLa: Bonum mihi quia humiliasti me: ut discam iustificationes tuas.

verses.textEn: The law of your mouth is good for me, beyond thousands of gold and silver pieces.
verses.textLa: Bonum mihi lex oris tui, super millia auri, et argenti.

verses.textEn: IOD. Your hands have created me and formed me. Give me understanding, and I will learn your commandments.
verses.textLa: IOD. Manus tuæ fecerunt me, et plasmaverunt me: da mihi intellectum, et discam mandata tua.

verses.textEn: Those who fear you will see me, and they will rejoice. For I have greatly hoped in your words.
verses.textLa: Qui timent te videbunt me, et lætabuntur: quia in verba tua supersperavi.

verses.textEn: I know, O Lord, that your judgments are fairness. And in your truth, you have humbled me.
verses.textLa: Cognovi Domine quia æquitas iudicia tua: et in veritate tua humiliasti me.

verses.textEn: Let it be your mercy that consoles me, according to your eloquence to your servant.
verses.textLa: Fiat misericordia tua ut consoletur me, secundum eloquium tuum servo tuo.

verses.textEn: Let your compassion draw near to me, and I will live. For your law is my meditation.
verses.textLa: Veniant mihi miserationes tuæ, et vivam: quia lex tua meditatio mea est.

verses.textEn: Let the arrogant be confounded, for unjustly they have done iniquity to me. But I will be trained in your commandments.
verses.textLa: Confundantur superbi, quia iniuste iniquitatem fecerunt in me: ego autem exercebor in mandatis tuis.

verses.textEn: Let those who fear you turn to me, along with those who know your testimonies.
verses.textLa: Convertantur mihi timentes te: et qui noverunt testimonia tua.

verses.textEn: Let my heart be immaculate in your justifications, so that I may not be confounded.
verses.textLa: Fiat cor meum immaculatum in iustificationibus tuis, ut non confundar.
verses.notes: In Latin, this verse brings to mind the Virgin Conception of Christ at the Annunciation. The word ‘immaculatum’ calls to mind the Immaculate Virgin, and the verb ‘fiat,’ (‘let it be,’ or, ‘amen’) calls to mind Mary’s consent (often called her ‘fiat’) to the Virgin Conception of Christ.

verses.textEn: CAPH. My soul has faltered in your salvation, yet in your word, I have hoped beyond hope.
verses.textLa: CAPH. Defecit in salutare tuum anima mea: et in verbum tuum supersperavi.

verses.textEn: My eyes have failed in your eloquence, saying, “When will you console me?”
verses.textLa: Defecerunt oculi mei in eloquium tuum, dicentes: Quando consolaberis me?

verses.textEn: For I have become like a wineskin in the frost. I have not forgotten your justifications.
verses.textLa: Quia factus sum sicut uter in pruina: iustificationes tuas non sum oblitus.
verses.notes: The expression ‘like a wineskin in the frost’ refers to being stiffened or hardened against adversity. The type of frost referred to is sometimes called ‘white frost.’ The word ‘uter’ refers to a skin used as a container, often for wine.

verses.textEn: How many are the days of your servant? When will you bring judgment against those who persecute me?
verses.textLa: Quot sunt dies servi tui: quando facies de persequentibus me iudicium?

verses.textEn: The iniquitous have spoken fables to me. But these are unlike your law.
verses.textLa: Narraverunt mihi iniqui fabulationes: sed non ut lex tua.

verses.textEn: All your commandments are truth. They have been persecuting me unjustly: assist me.
verses.textLa: Omnia mandata tua veritas: inique persecuti sunt me, adiuva me.

verses.textEn: They have nearly consumed me on earth. Yet I have not forsaken your commandments.
verses.textLa: Paulominus consummaverunt me in terra: ego autem non dereliqui mandata tua.

verses.textEn: Revive me according to your mercy. And I will keep the testimonies of your mouth.
verses.textLa: Secundum misericordiam tuam vivifica me: et custodiam testimonia oris tui.

verses.textEn: LAMED. O Lord, your word remains firm in heaven, for all eternity.
verses.textLa: LAMED. In æternum Domine, verbum tuum permanet in cælo.

verses.textEn: Your truth is from generation to generation. You have founded the earth, and it remains firm.
verses.textLa: In generationem et generationem veritas tua: fundasti terram, et permanet.

verses.textEn: By your ordinance, the day perseveres. For all things are in service to you.
verses.textLa: Ordinatione tua perseverat dies: quoniam omnia serviunt tibi.

verses.textEn: If your law had not been my meditation, then perhaps I would have perished in my humiliation.
verses.textLa: Nisi quod lex tua meditatio mea est: tunc forte periissem in humilitate mea.

verses.textEn: I will not forget your justifications, for eternity. For by them, you have enlivened me.
verses.textLa: In æternum non obliviscar iustificationes tuas: quia in ipsis vivificasti me.

verses.textEn: I am yours. Accomplish my salvation. For I have inquired into your justifications.
verses.textLa: Tuus sum ego, salvum me fac: quoniam iustificationes tuas exquisivi.

verses.textEn: The sinners have waited for me, in order to destroy me. I have understood your testimonies.
verses.textLa: Me expectaverunt peccatores ut perderent me: testimonia tua intellexi.

verses.textEn: I have seen the end of the consummation of all things. Your commandment is exceedingly broad.
verses.textLa: Omnis consummationis vidi finem: latum mandatum tuum nimis.

verses.textEn: MEM. How have I loved your law, O Lord? It is my meditation all day long.
verses.textLa: MEM. Quomodo dilexi legem tuam Domine? tota die meditatio mea est.

verses.textEn: By your commandment, you have made me able to see far, beyond my enemies. For it is with me for eternity.
verses.textLa: Super inimicos meos prudentem me fecisti mandato tuo: quia in æternum mihi est.

verses.textEn: I have understood beyond all my teachers. For your testimonies are my meditation.
verses.textLa: Super omnes docentes me intellexi: quia testimonia tua meditatio mea est.

verses.textEn: I have understood beyond the elders. For I have searched your commandments.
verses.textLa: Super senes intellexi: quia mandata tua quæsivi.

verses.textEn: I have prohibited my feet from every evil way, so that I may keep your words.
verses.textLa: Ab omni via mala prohibui pedes meos: ut custodiam verba tua.

verses.textEn: I have not declined from your judgments, because you have stationed a law for me.
verses.textLa: A iudiciis tuis non declinavi: quia tu legem posuisti mihi.

verses.textEn: How sweet is your eloquence to my palate, more so than honey to my mouth!
verses.textLa: Quam dulcia faucibus meis eloquia tua, super mel ori meo!

verses.textEn: I obtained understanding by your commandments. Because of this, I have hated every way of iniquity.
verses.textLa: A mandatis tuis intellexi: propterea odivi omnem viam iniquitatis.

verses.textEn: NUN. Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my paths.
verses.textLa: NUN. Lucerna pedibus meis verbum tuum, et lumen semitis meis.

verses.textEn: I have sworn it, and so I am determined to keep the judgments of your justice.
verses.textLa: Iuravi, et statui custodire iudicia iustitiæ tuæ.

verses.textEn: I have been altogether humbled, Lord. Revive me according to your word.
verses.textLa: Humiliatus sum usquequaque Domine: vivifica me secundum verbum tuum.

verses.textEn: Make the willing offerings of my mouth well pleasing, Lord, and teach me your judgments.
verses.textLa: Voluntaria oris mei beneplacita fac Domine: et iudicia tua doce me.

verses.textEn: My soul is always in my hands, and I have not forgotten your law.
verses.textLa: Anima mea in manibus meis semper: et legem tuam non sum oblitus.

verses.textEn: Sinners have set a snare for me, yet I have not strayed from your commandments.
verses.textLa: Posuerunt peccatores laqueum mihi: et de mandatis tuis non erravi.

verses.textEn: I have acquired your testimonies as an inheritance unto eternity, because they are the exultation of my heart.
verses.textLa: Hereditate acquisivi testimonia tua in æternum: quia exultatio cordis mei sunt.

verses.textEn: I have inclined my heart to do your justifications for eternity, as a recompense.
verses.textLa: Inclinavi cor meum ad faciendas iustificationes tuas in æternum, propter retributionem.

verses.textEn: SAMECH. I have hated the iniquitous, and I have loved your law.
verses.textLa: SAMECH. Iniquos odio habui: et legem tuam dilexi.

verses.textEn: You are my helper and my supporter. And in your word, I have greatly hoped.
verses.textLa: Adiutor, et susceptor meus es tu: et in verbum tuum supersperavi.

verses.textEn: Turn away from me, you malignant ones. And I will examine the commandments of my God.
verses.textLa: Declinate a me maligni: et scrutabor mandata Dei mei.

verses.textEn: Uphold me according to your eloquence, and I will live. And let me not be confounded in my expectation.
verses.textLa: Suscipe me secundum eloquium tuum, et vivam: et non confundas me ab expectatione mea.

verses.textEn: Help me, and I will be saved. And I will meditate always on your justifications.
verses.textLa: Adiuva me, et salvus ero: et meditabor in iustificationibus tuis semper.

verses.textEn: You have despised all those who fell away from your judgments. For their intention is unjust.
verses.textLa: Sprevisti omnes discedentes a iudiciis tuis: quia iniusta cogitatio eorum.

verses.textEn: I have considered all the sinners of the earth to be transgressors. Therefore, I have loved your testimonies.
verses.textLa: Prævaricantes reputavi omnes peccatores terræ: ideo dilexi testimonia tua.

verses.textEn: Pierce my flesh with your fear, for I am afraid of your judgments.
verses.textLa: Confige timore tuo carnes meas: a iudiciis enim tuis timui.

verses.textEn: AIN. I have accomplished judgment and justice. Do not hand me over to those who slander me.
verses.textLa: AIN. Feci iudicium et iustitiam: non tradas me calumniantibus me.

verses.textEn: Uphold your servant in what is good. And do not allow the arrogant to slander me.
verses.textLa: Suscipe servum tuum in bonum: non calumnientur me superbi.

verses.textEn: My eyes have failed in your salvation and in the eloquence of your justice.
verses.textLa: Oculi mei defecerunt in salutare tuum: et in eloquium iustitiæ tuæ.

verses.textEn: Deal with your servant according to your mercy, and teach me your justifications.
verses.textLa: Fac cum servo tuo secundum misericordiam tuam: et iustificationes tuas doce me.

verses.textEn: I am your servant. Give me understanding, so that I may know your testimonies.
verses.textLa: Servus tuus sum ego: da mihi intellectum, ut sciam testimonia tua.

verses.textEn: It is time to act, O Lord. They have dissipated your law.
verses.textLa: Tempus faciendi Domine: dissipaverunt legem tuam.

verses.textEn: Therefore, I have loved your commandments beyond gold and topaz.
verses.textLa: Ideo dilexi mandata tua, super aurum et topazion.

verses.textEn: Because of this, I was directed toward all your commandments. I held hatred for every iniquitous way.
verses.textLa: Propterea ad omnia mandata tua dirigebar: omnem viam iniquam odio habui.

verses.textEn: PHE. Your testimonies are wonderful. Therefore, my soul has been examined by them.
verses.textLa: PHE. Mirabilia testimonia tua: ideo scrutata est ea anima mea.

verses.textEn: The declaration of your words illuminates, and it gives understanding to little ones.
verses.textLa: Declaratio sermonum tuorum illuminat: et intellectum dat parvulis.

verses.textEn: I opened my mouth and drew breath, for I desired your commandments.
verses.textLa: Os meum aperui, et attraxi spiritum: quia mandata tua desiderabam.

verses.textEn: Gaze upon me and be merciful to me, according to the judgment of those who love your name.
verses.textLa: Aspice in me, et miserere mei, secundum iudicium diligentium nomen tuum.

verses.textEn: Direct my steps according to your eloquence, and let no injustice rule over me.
verses.textLa: Gressus meos dirige secundum eloquium tuum: et non dominetur mei omnis iniustitia.

verses.textEn: Redeem me from the slanders of men, so that I may keep your commandments.
verses.textLa: Redime me a calumniis hominum: ut custodiam mandata tua.

verses.textEn: Make your face shine upon your servant, and teach me your justifications.
verses.textLa: Faciem tuam illumina super servum tuum: et doce me iustificationes tuas.

verses.textEn: My eyes have gushed like springs of water, because they have not kept your law.
verses.textLa: Exitus aquarum deduxerunt oculi mei: quia non custodierunt legem tuam.

verses.textEn: SADE. You are just, O Lord, and your judgment is right.
verses.textLa: SADE. Iustus es Domine: et rectum iudicium tuum.

verses.textEn: You have commanded justice: your testimonies and your truth even more so.
verses.textLa: Mandasti iustitiam testimonia tua: et veritatem tuam nimis.

verses.textEn: My zeal has caused me to pine away, because my enemies have forgotten your words.
verses.textLa: Tabescere me fecit zelus meus: quia obliti sunt verba tua inimici mei.

verses.textEn: Your eloquence has been greatly enflamed, and your servant has loved it.
verses.textLa: Ignitum eloquium tuum vehementer: et servus tuus dilexit illud.

verses.textEn: I am young and treated with contempt. But I have not forgotten your justifications.
verses.textLa: Adolescentulus sum ego, et contemptus: iustificationes tuas non sum oblitus.

verses.textEn: Your justice is justice for all eternity, and your law is truth.
verses.textLa: Iustitia tua, iustitia in æternum: et lex tua veritas.

verses.textEn: Tribulation and anguish have found me. Your commandments are my meditation.
verses.textLa: Tribulatio, et angustia invenerunt me: mandata tua meditatio mea est.

verses.textEn: Your testimonies are fairness unto eternity. Give me understanding, and I will live.
verses.textLa: Æquitas testimonia tua in æternum: intellectum da mihi, et vivam.

verses.textEn: COPH. I cried out with my whole heart. Heed me, O Lord. I will ask for your justifications.
verses.textLa: COPH. Clamavi in toto corde meo, exaudi me Domine: iustificationes tuas requiram.

verses.textEn: I cried out to you. Save me, so that I may keep your commandments.
verses.textLa: Clamavi ad te, salvum me fac: ut custodiam mandata tua.

verses.textEn: I arrived first in maturity, and so I cried out. For in your words, I have hoped beyond hope.
verses.textLa: Præveni in maturitate, et clamavi: quia in verba tua supersperavi.

verses.textEn: My eyes preceded the dawn for you, so that I might meditate on your eloquence.
verses.textLa: Prævenerunt oculi mei ad te diluculo: ut meditarer eloquia tua.

verses.textEn: Hear my voice according to your mercy, O Lord. And revive me according to your judgment.
verses.textLa: Vocem meam audi secundum misericordiam tuam Domine: et secundum iudicium tuum vivifica me.

verses.textEn: Those who persecute me have drawn near to iniquity, but they have been brought far from your law.
verses.textLa: Appropinquaverunt persequentes me iniquitati: a lege autem tua longe facti sunt.

verses.textEn: You are near, O Lord, and all your ways are truth.
verses.textLa: Prope es tu Domine: et omnes viæ tuæ veritas.

verses.textEn: I have known from the beginning about your testimonies. For you founded them in eternity.
verses.textLa: Initio cognovi de testimoniis tuis: quia in æternum fundasti ea.

verses.textEn: RES. See my humiliation and rescue me, for I have not forgotten your law.
verses.textLa: RES. Vide humilitatem meam, et eripe me: quia legem tuam non sum oblitus.

verses.textEn: Judge my judgment and redeem me. Revive me because of your eloquence.
verses.textLa: Iudica iudicium meum, et redime me: propter eloquium tuum vivifica me.

verses.textEn: Salvation is far from sinners, because they have not inquired about your justifications.
verses.textLa: Longe a peccatoribus salus: quia iustificationes tuas non exquisierunt.

verses.textEn: Many are your mercies, O Lord. Enliven me according to your judgment.
verses.textLa: Misericordiæ tuæ multæ Domine: secundum iudicium tuum vivifica me.

verses.textEn: Many are those who persecute me and who trouble me. I have not turned away from your testimonies.
verses.textLa: Multi qui persequuntur me, et tribulant me: a testimoniis tuis non declinavi.

verses.textEn: I saw the prevaricators, and I pine away. For they have not kept your word.
verses.textLa: Vidi prævaricantes, et tabescebam: quia eloquia tua non custodierunt.
verses.notes: Or, ‘For they have not kept your eloquent word.’ Prevaricators are persons who are unfaithful, or who deceive and betray. The word ‘tabescebam’ can refer to melting away or dwindling away or pining away.

verses.textEn: O Lord, see how I have loved your commandments. Revive me in your mercy.
verses.textLa: Vide quoniam mandata tua dilexi Domine: in misericordia tua vivifica me.

verses.textEn: The beginning of your words is truth. All the judgments of your justice are for eternity.
verses.textLa: Principium verborum tuorum, veritas: in æternum omnia iudicia iustitiæ tuæ.

verses.textEn: SIN. The leaders have persecuted me without cause. And my heart has been awed by your words.
verses.textLa: SIN. Principes persecuti sunt me gratis: et a verbis tuis formidavit cor meum.

verses.textEn: I will rejoice over your eloquence, like one who has found many spoils.
verses.textLa: Lætabor ego super eloquia tua: sicut qui invenit spolia multa.

verses.textEn: I have held hatred for iniquity, and I have abhorred it. Yet I have loved your law.
verses.textLa: Iniquitatem odio habui, et abominatus sum: legem autem tuam dilexi.

verses.textEn: Seven times a day, I uttered praise to you about the judgments of your justice.
verses.textLa: Septies in die laudem dixi tibi, super iudicia iustitiæ tuæ.

verses.textEn: Those who love your law have great peace, and there is no scandal for them.
verses.textLa: Pax multa diligentibus legem tuam: et non est illis scandalum.

verses.textEn: I have waited for your salvation, O Lord. And I have loved your commandments.
verses.textLa: Expectabam salutare tuum Domine: et mandata tua dilexi.

verses.textEn: My soul has kept to your testimonies and has loved them exceedingly.
verses.textLa: Custodivit anima mea testimonia tua: et dilexit ea vehementer.

verses.textEn: I have served your commandments and your testimonies. For all my ways are before your sight.
verses.textLa: Servavi mandata tua, et testimonia tua: quia omnes viæ meæ in conspectu tuo.

verses.textEn: TAU. O Lord, let my supplication draw near in your sight. Grant understanding to me according to your eloquence.
verses.textLa: TAU. Appropinquet deprecatio mea in conspectu tuo Domine: iuxta eloquium tuum da mihi intellectum.

verses.textEn: Let my petition enter before you. Rescue me according to your word.
verses.textLa: Intret postulatio mea in conspectu tuo: secundum eloquium tuum eripe me.

verses.textEn: A hymn will burst forth from my lips, when you will teach me your justifications.
verses.textLa: Eructabunt labia mea hymnum, cum docueris me iustificationes tuas.

verses.textEn: My tongue will pronounce your eloquence. For all your commandments are fairness.
verses.textLa: Pronunciabit lingua mea eloquium tuum: quia omnia mandata tua æquitas.

verses.textEn: Let it be your hand that saves me. For I have chosen your commandments.
verses.textLa: Fiat manus tua ut salvet me: quoniam mandata tua elegi.

verses.textEn: O Lord, I have longed for your salvation, and your law is my meditation.
verses.textLa: Concupivi salutare tuum Domine: et lex tua meditatio mea est.

verses.textEn: My soul will live and will praise you, and your judgments will assist me.
verses.textLa: Vivet anima mea, et laudabit te: et iudicia tua adiuvabunt me.

verses.textEn: I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost. Seek out your servant, for I have not forgotten your commandments.
verses.textLa: Erravi, sicut ovis, quæ periit: quære servum tuum, quia mandata tua non sum oblitus.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. When troubled, I cried out to the Lord, and he heard me.
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. Ad Dominum cum tribularer clamavi: et exaudivit me.

verses.textEn: O Lord, free my soul from lips of iniquity and from the deceitful tongue.
verses.textLa: Domine libera animam meam a labiis iniquis, et a lingua dolosa.

verses.textEn: What will be given to you, or what will be added to you, for a deceitful tongue?:
verses.textLa: Quid detur tibi, aut quid apponatur tibi ad linguam dolosam?

verses.textEn: the sharp arrows of the powerful, along with the burning coals of desolation.
verses.textLa: Sagittæ potentis acutæ, cum carbonibus desolatoriis.
verses.notes: In other words, there will be nothing left but burning embers.

verses.textEn: Woe to me, for my sojourning has been prolonged. I have lived with the inhabitants of Kedar.
verses.textLa: Heu mihi, quia incolatus meus prolongatus est: habitavi cum habitantibus Cedar:

verses.textEn: My soul has long been a sojourner.
verses.textLa: multum incola fuit anima mea.

verses.textEn: With those who hated peace, I was peaceful. When I spoke to them, they fought against me without cause.
verses.textLa: Cum his, qui oderunt pacem, eram pacificus: cum loquebar illis, impugnabant me gratis.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. I have lifted up my eyes to the mountains; from thence help will come to me.
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. Levavi oculos meos in montes, unde veniet auxilium mihi.

verses.textEn: My help is from the Lord, who made heaven and earth.
verses.textLa: Auxilium meum a Domino, qui fecit cælum et terram.

verses.textEn: May he not allow your foot to be moved, and may he not slumber, who guards you.
verses.textLa: Non det in commotionem pedem tuum: neque dormitet qui custodit te.

verses.textEn: Behold, he who guards Israel will neither sleep, nor slumber.
verses.textLa: Ecce non dormitabit neque dormiet, qui custodit Israel.

verses.textEn: The Lord is your keeper, the Lord is your protection, above your right hand.
verses.textLa: Dominus custodit te, Dominus protectio tua, super manum dexteram tuam.

verses.textEn: The sun will not burn you by day, nor the moon by night.
verses.textLa: Per diem sol non uret te: neque luna per noctem.

verses.textEn: The Lord guards you from all evil. May the Lord guard your soul.
verses.textLa: Dominus custodit te ab omni malo: custodiat animam tuam Dominus.

verses.textEn: May the Lord guard your entrance and your exit, from this time forward and even forever.
verses.textLa: Dominus custodiat introitum tuum, et exitum tuum: ex hoc nunc, et usque in sæculum.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. I rejoiced in the things that were said to me: “We shall go into the house of the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. Lætatus sum in his, quæ dicta sunt mihi: In domum Domini ibimus.

verses.textEn: Our feet were standing in your courts, O Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Stantes erant pedes nostri, in atriis tuis Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: Jerusalem has been built as a city, whose participation is unto itself.
verses.textLa: Ierusalem, quæ ædificatur ut civitas: cuius participatio eius in idipsum.
verses.notes: Jerusalem is a city unto itself. Other cities must look to Jerusalem for leadership and guidance. Jerusalem is a city that looks inward for what it needs.

verses.textEn: For to that place, the tribes ascended, the tribes of the Lord: the testimony of Israel, to confess to the name of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Illuc enim ascenderunt tribus, tribus Domini: testimonium Israel ad confitendum nomini Domini.

verses.textEn: For in that place, seats have sat down in judgment, seats above the house of David.
verses.textLa: Quia illic sederunt sedes in iudicio, sedes super domum David.
verses.notes: Jerusalem is above Bethlehem, both literally and figuratively. Figuratively, the house of David is the Jewish faith and the city of Jerusalem represents the Catholic faith. Literally, Jerusalem is a greater city and higher in elevation than Bethlehem.

verses.textEn: Petition for the things that are for the peace of Jerusalem, and for abundance for those who love you.
verses.textLa: Rogate quæ ad pacem sunt Ierusalem: et abundantia diligentibus te.
verses.notes: The verb ‘rogate’ is also used in Latin to refer to legislators, who must petition for a bill to become law. So, this verse also means that we should seek laws that are towards the peace of Jerusalem.

verses.textEn: Let peace be in your virtue, and abundance in your towers.
verses.textLa: Fiat pax in virtute tua: et abundantia in turribus tuis.

verses.textEn: For the sake of my brothers and my neighbors, I spoke peace about you.
verses.textLa: Propter fratres meos, et proximos meos, loquebar pacem de te:

verses.textEn: For the sake of the house of the Lord our God, I sought good things for you.
verses.textLa: Propter domum Domini Dei nostri, quæsivi bona tibi.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. I have lifted up my eyes to you, who dwells in the heavens.
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. Ad te levavi oculos meos, qui habitas in cælis.

verses.textEn: Behold, as the eyes of the servants are on the hands of their masters, as the eyes of the handmaid are on the hands of her mistress, so our eyes are upon the Lord our God, until he may be merciful to us.
verses.textLa: Ecce sicut oculi servorum, in manibus dominorum suorum, Sicut oculi ancillæ in manibus dominæ suæ: ita oculi nostri ad Dominum Deum nostrum donec misereatur nostri.

verses.textEn: Have mercy on us, O Lord, have mercy on us. For we have been filled with utter disdain.
verses.textLa: Miserere nostri Domine, miserere nostri: quia multum repleti sumus despectione:

verses.textEn: For our soul has been greatly filled. We are the disgrace of those who have abundance and the disdain of the arrogant.
verses.textLa: Quia multum repleta est anima nostra: opprobrium abundantibus, et despectio superbis.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. If the Lord had not been with us, let Israel now say it:
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. Nisi quia Dominus erat in nobis, dicat nunc Israel:

verses.textEn: if the Lord had not been with us, when men rose up against us,
verses.textLa: nisi quia Dominus erat in nobis, Cum exurgerent homines in nos,

verses.textEn: perhaps they would have swallowed us alive. When their fury was enraged against us,
verses.textLa: forte vivos deglutissent nos: Cum irasceretur furor eorum in nos,

verses.textEn: perhaps the waters would have engulfed us.
verses.textLa: forsitan aqua absorbuisset nos.

verses.textEn: Our soul has passed through a torrent. Perhaps, our soul had even passed through intolerable water.
verses.textLa: Torrentem pertransivit anima nostra: forsitan pertransisset anima nostra aquam intolerabilem.

verses.textEn: Blessed is the Lord, who has not given us into the harm of their teeth.
verses.textLa: Benedictus Dominus qui non dedit nos, in captionem dentibus eorum.

verses.textEn: Our soul has been snatched away like a sparrow from the snare of the hunters. The snare has been broken, and we have been freed.
verses.textLa: Anima nostra sicut passer erepta est de laqueo venantium: Laqueus contritus est, et nos liberati sumus.

verses.textEn: Our help is in the name of the Lord, who made heaven and earth.
verses.textLa: Adiutorium nostrum in nomine Domini, qui fecit cælum et terram.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. Those who trust in the Lord will be like the mountain of Zion. He will not be disturbed for eternity, who dwells
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. Qui confidunt in Domino, sicut mons Sion: non commovebitur in æternum, qui habitat

verses.textEn: in Jerusalem. Mountains surround it. And the Lord surrounds his people, from this time forward and even forever.
verses.textLa: in Ierusalem. Montes in circuitu eius: et Dominus in circuitu populi sui, ex hoc nunc et usque in sæculum.

verses.textEn: For the Lord will not allow the rod of sinners to remain over the lot of the just, so that the just may not extend their hands toward iniquity.
verses.textLa: Quia non relinquet Dominus virgam peccatorum super sortem iustorum: ut non extendant iusti ad iniquitatem manus suas.

verses.textEn: Do good, O Lord, to the good and to the upright of heart.
verses.textLa: Benefac Domine bonis, et rectis corde.

verses.textEn: But those who turn away into obligation, the Lord will lead away with the workers of iniquity. Peace be upon Israel.
verses.textLa: Declinantes autem in obligationes, adducet Dominus cum operantibus iniquitatem: pax super Israel.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. When the Lord turned back the captivity of Zion, we became like those who are consoled.
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. In convertendo Dominus captivitatem Sion: facti sumus sicut consolati:

verses.textEn: Then our mouth was filled with gladness and our tongue with exultation. Then they will say among the nations: “The Lord has done great things for them.”
verses.textLa: Tunc repletum est gaudio os nostrum: et lingua nostra exultatione. Tunc dicent inter gentes: Magnificavit Dominus facere cum eis.

verses.textEn: The Lord has done great things for us. We have become joyful.
verses.textLa: Magnificavit Dominus facere nobiscum: facti sumus lætantes.

verses.textEn: Convert our captivity, O Lord, like a torrent in the south.
verses.textLa: Converte Domine captivitatem nostram, sicut torrens in Austro.

verses.textEn: Those who sow in tears shall reap in exultation.
verses.textLa: Qui seminant in lacrymis, in exultatione metent.

verses.textEn: When departing, they went forth and wept, sowing their seeds.
verses.textLa: Euntes ibant et flebant, mittentes semina sua.

verses.textEn: But when returning, they will arrive with exultation, carrying their sheaves.
verses.textLa: Venientes autem venient cum exultatione, portantes manipulos suos.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps: of Solomon. Unless the Lord has built the house, those who build it have labored in vain. Unless the Lord has guarded the city, he who guards it watches in vain.
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum Salomonis. Nisi Dominus ædificaverit domum, in vanum laboraverunt qui ædificant eam. Nisi Dominus custodierit civitatem, frustra vigilat qui custodit eam.

verses.textEn: It is in vain that you rise before daylight, that you rise up after you have sat down, you who chew the bread of sorrow. Whereas, to his beloved, he will give sleep.
verses.textLa: Vanum est vobis ante lucem surgere: surgite postquam sederitis, qui manducatis panem doloris. Cum dederit dilectis suis somnum.

verses.textEn: Behold, the inheritance of the Lord is sons, the reward is the fruit of the womb.
verses.textLa: Ecce hereditas Domini filii: merces, fructus ventris.

verses.textEn: Like arrows in the hand of the powerful, so are the sons of those who have been cast out.
verses.textLa: Sicut sagittæ in manu potentis: ita filii excussorum.
verses.notes: Those who have been cast out of the Church (heretics and apostates and schismatics), will be used against the Church by its enemies.

verses.textEn: Blessed is the man who has filled his desire from these things. He will not be confounded when he speaks to his enemies at the gate.
verses.textLa: Beatus vir qui implevit desiderium suum ex ipsis: non confundetur cum loquetur inimicis suis in porta.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. Blessed are all those who fear the Lord, who walk in his ways.
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. Beati omnes, qui timent Dominum, qui ambulant in viis eius.

verses.textEn: For you will eat by the labors of your hands. Blessed are you, and it will be well with you.
verses.textLa: Labores manuum tuarum quia manducabis: beatus es, et bene tibi erit.

verses.textEn: Your wife is like an abundant vine on the sides of your house. Your sons are like young olive trees surrounding your table.
verses.textLa: Uxor tua sicut vitis abundans, in lateribus domus tuæ. Filii tui sicut novellæ olivarum, in circuitu mensæ tuæ.

verses.textEn: Behold, so will the man be blessed who fears the Lord.
verses.textLa: Ecce sic benedicetur homo, qui timet Dominum.

verses.textEn: May the Lord bless you from Zion, and may you see the good things of Jerusalem, all the days of your life.
verses.textLa: Benedicat tibi Dominus ex Sion: et videas bona Ierusalem omnibus diebus vitæ tuæ.

verses.textEn: And may you see the sons of your sons. Peace be upon Israel.
verses.textLa: Et videas filios filiorum tuorum, pacem super Israel.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. They have often fought against me from my youth, let Israel now say:
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. Sæpe expugnaverunt me a iuventute mea, dicat nunc Israel.

verses.textEn: they have often fought against me from my youth, yet they could not prevail over me.
verses.textLa: Sæpe expugnaverunt me a iuventute mea: etenim non potuerunt mihi.

verses.textEn: The sinners have made fabrications behind my back. They have prolonged their iniquity.
verses.textLa: Supra dorsum meum fabricaverunt peccatores: prolongaverunt iniquitatem suam.

verses.textEn: The just Lord will cut the necks of sinners.
verses.textLa: Dominus iustus concidit cervices peccatorum:

verses.textEn: Let all those who hate Zion be confounded and turned backwards.
verses.textLa: confundantur et convertantur retrorsum omnes, qui oderunt Sion.

verses.textEn: Let them be like grass on the rooftops, which withers before it can be pulled up:
verses.textLa: Fiant sicut fœnum tectorum: quod priusquam evellatur, exaruit:

verses.textEn: with it, he who reaps does not fill his hand and he who gathers sheaves does not fill his bosom.
verses.textLa: De quo non implevit manum suam qui metit, et sinum suum qui manipulos colligit.

verses.textEn: And those who were passing by have not said to them: “The blessing of the Lord be upon you. We have blessed you in the name of the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Et non dixerunt qui præteribant: Benedictio Domini super vos: benediximus vobis in nomine Domini.
verses.notes: This verse refers again to those who hate Zion, who are like grass on the rooftops, so the words ‘about these’ are added to clarify this reference.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. From the depths, I have cried out to you, O Lord.
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. De profundis clamavi ad te Domine:

verses.textEn: O Lord, hear my voice. Let your ears be attentive to the voice of my supplication.
verses.textLa: Domine exaudi vocem meam: Fiant aures tuæ intendentes, in vocem deprecationis meæ.

verses.textEn: If you, O Lord, were to heed iniquities, who, O Lord, could persevere?
verses.textLa: Si iniquitates observaveris Domine: Domine quis sustinebit?

verses.textEn: For with you, there is forgiveness, and because of your law, I persevered with you, Lord. My soul has persevered in his word.
verses.textLa: Quia apud te propitiatio est: et propter legem tuam sustinui te Domine. Sustinuit anima mea in verbo eius:

verses.textEn: My soul has hoped in the Lord.
verses.textLa: speravit anima mea in Domino.

verses.textEn: From the morning watch, even until night, let Israel hope in the Lord.
verses.textLa: A custodia matutina usque ad noctem: speret Israel in Domino.

verses.textEn: For with the Lord there is mercy, and with him there is bountiful redemption.
verses.textLa: Quia apud Dominum misericordia: et copiosa apud eum redemptio.

verses.textEn: And he will redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
verses.textLa: Et ipse redimet Israel, ex omnibus iniquitatibus eius.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps: of David. O Lord, my heart has not been exalted, and my eyes have not been raised up. Neither have I walked in greatness, nor in wonders beyond me.
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum David. Domine non est exaltatum cor meum: neque elati sunt oculi mei. Neque ambulavi in magnis: neque in mirabilibus super me.

verses.textEn: When I was not humble in thought, then I lifted up my soul. Like one who has been weaned from his mother, so was I recompensed in my soul.
verses.textLa: Si non humiliter sentiebam: sed exaltavi animam meam: Sicut ablactatus est super matre sua, ita retributio in anima mea.

verses.textEn: Let Israel hope in the Lord, from this time forward and even forever.
verses.textLa: Speret Israel in Domino, ex hoc nunc et usque in sæculum.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. O Lord, remember David and all his meekness,
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. Memento Domine David, et omnis mansuetudinis eius:
verses.notes: The expression ‘a canticle in steps’ refers to this set of Psalms, which together are one Canticle, with each Psalm being a step.

verses.textEn: how he swore to the Lord, how he made a vow to the God of Jacob:
verses.textLa: Sicut iuravit Domino, votum vovit Deo Iacob:

verses.textEn: I shall not enter into the tabernacle of my house, nor climb into the bed where I lie down;
verses.textLa: Si introiero in tabernaculum domus meæ, si ascendero in lectum strati mei:

verses.textEn: I shall not give sleep to my eyes, nor slumber to my eyelids
verses.textLa: Si dedero somnum oculis meis, et palpebris meis dormitationem:

verses.textEn: and rest to my temples, until I find a place for the Lord, a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.
verses.textLa: Et requiem temporibus meis: donec inveniam locum Domino, tabernaculum Deo Iacob.

verses.textEn: Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah. We discovered it in the fields of the forest.
verses.textLa: Ecce audivimus eam in Ephrata: invenimus eam in campis silvæ.

verses.textEn: We will enter into his tabernacle. We will adore in the place where his feet stood.
verses.textLa: Introibimus in tabernaculum eius: adorabimus in loco, ubi steterunt pedes eius.

verses.textEn: Rise up, O Lord, into your resting place. You and the ark of your sanctification.
verses.textLa: Surge Domine in requiem tuam, tu et arca sanctificationis tuæ.
verses.notes: This verse refers to the Ascension of our Lord and to the Assumption of the Virgin Mary. She is symbolized by the Ark of the Covenant. The Ark contained the Covenant just as the Virgin Mary contained Christ in her womb and in her heart. This passage also indicates that when Christ returns, Mary will return with him; then, at the Second Ascension, Christ will ascend to Heaven and Mary will again be assumed into Heaven, rising up with him to the place of eternal rest.

verses.textEn: Let your priests be clothed with justice, and let your saints exult.
verses.textLa: Sacerdotes tui induantur iustitiam: et sancti tui exultent.

verses.textEn: For the sake of your servant David, do not turn away the face of your Christ.
verses.textLa: Propter David servum tuum, non avertas faciem Christi tui.

verses.textEn: The Lord has sworn the truth to David, and he will not disappoint: I will set upon your throne from the fruit of your lineage.
verses.textLa: Iuravit Dominus David veritatem, et non frustrabitur eam: de fructu ventris tui ponam super sedem tuam.
verses.notes: Here is a good example of the use of the word ‘ventris’ to refer to the generative capability of men (as well as women). It is usually translated as womb, but the verse refers to David and the word ‘ventris’ is masculine. In other words, ‘from the fruit of your lineage,’ or, ‘from the fruit of your loins.’

verses.textEn: If your sons will keep my covenant and these, my testimonies, which I will teach to them, then their sons will sit upon your throne even forever.
verses.textLa: Si custodierint filii tui testamentum meum, et testimonia mea hæc, quæ docebo eos: Et filii eorum usque in sæculum, sedebunt super sedem tuam.

verses.textEn: For the Lord has chosen Zion. He has chosen it as his dwelling place.
verses.textLa: Quoniam elegit Dominus Sion: elegit eam in habitationem sibi.

verses.textEn: This is my resting place, forever and ever. Here I will dwell, for I have chosen it.
verses.textLa: Hæc requies mea in sæculum sæculi: hic habitabo, quoniam elegi eam.

verses.textEn: When blessing, I will bless her widow. I will satisfy her poor with bread.
verses.textLa: Viduam eius benedicens benedicam: pauperes eius saturabo panibus.

verses.textEn: I will clothe her priests with salvation, and her saints will rejoice with great joy.
verses.textLa: Sacerdotes eius induam salutari: et sancti eius exultatione exultabunt.

verses.textEn: There, I will produce a horn to David. There, I have prepared a lamp for my Christ.
verses.textLa: Illuc producam cornu David, paravi lucernam Christo meo.

verses.textEn: I will clothe his enemies with confusion. But my sanctification will flourish over him.
verses.textLa: Inimicos eius induam confusione: super ipsum autem efflorebit sanctificatio mea.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps: of David. Behold, how good and how pleasing it is for brothers to dwell in unity.
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum David. Ecce quam bonum et quam iucundum habitare fratres in unum:

verses.textEn: It is like the ointment on the head that descended to the beard, the beard of Aaron, which descended to the hem of his garment.
verses.textLa: Sicut unguentum in capite, quod descendit in barbam, barbam Aaron, Quod descendit in oram vestimenti eius:

verses.textEn: It is like the dew of Hermon, which descended from mount Zion. For in that place, the Lord has commanded a blessing, and life, even unto eternity.
verses.textLa: sicut ros Hermon, qui descendit in montem Sion. Quoniam illic mandavit Dominus benedictionem, et vitam usque in sæculum.

verses.textEn: A Canticle in steps. Behold, bless the Lord now, all you servants of the Lord, who stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God.
verses.textLa: Canticum graduum. Ecce nunc benedicite Dominum, omnes servi Domini: Qui statis in domo Domini, in atriis domus Dei nostri,

verses.textEn: In the nights, lift up your hands in sanctity, and bless the Lord.
verses.textLa: In noctibus extollite manus vestras in sancta, et benedicite Dominum.

verses.textEn: May the Lord, who made heaven and earth, bless you from Zion.
verses.textLa: Benedicat te Dominus ex Sion, qui fecit cælum et terram.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Praise the name of the Lord. You servants, praise the Lord.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Laudate nomen Domini, laudate servi Dominum:

verses.textEn: You who stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God:
verses.textLa: Qui statis in domo Domini, in atriis domus Dei nostri.

verses.textEn: praise the Lord, for the Lord is good. Sing psalms to his name, for it is sweet.
verses.textLa: Laudate Dominum, quia bonus Dominus: psallite nomini eius, quoniam suave.

verses.textEn: For the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself, Israel for his own possession.
verses.textLa: Quoniam Iacob elegit sibi Dominus Israel in possessionem sibi.

verses.textEn: For I have known that the Lord is great, and our God is before all gods.
verses.textLa: Quia ego cognovi quod magnus est Dominus, et Deus noster præ omnibus diis.

verses.textEn: All things whatsoever that he willed, the Lord did: in heaven, on earth, in the sea, and in all the deep places.
verses.textLa: Omnia quæcumque voluit, Dominus fecit in cælo, in terra, in mari, et in omnibus abyssis.

verses.textEn: He leads clouds from the ends of the earth. He has created lightnings in the rain. He has produced winds from his storehouses.
verses.textLa: Educens nubes ab extremo terræ: fulgura in pluviam fecit. Qui producit ventos de thesauris suis:

verses.textEn: He struck the first-born of Egypt, from man even to cattle.
verses.textLa: qui percussit primogenita Ægypti ab homine usque ad pecus.

verses.textEn: He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt: upon Pharaoh and upon all his servants.
verses.textLa: Et misit signa, et prodigia in medio tui Ægypte: in Pharaonem, et in omnes servos eius.

verses.textEn: He has struck many nations, and he has slaughtered strong kings:
verses.textLa: Qui percussit gentes multas: et occidit reges fortes:

verses.textEn: Sihon, king of the Amorites, and Og, king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan.
verses.textLa: Sehon regem Amorrhæorum, et Og regem Basan, et omnia regna Chanaan.

verses.textEn: And he gave their land as an inheritance, as an inheritance for his people Israel.
verses.textLa: Et dedit terram eorum hereditatem, hereditatem Israel populo suo.

verses.textEn: Your name, O Lord, is in eternity. Your memorial, O Lord, is from generation to generation.
verses.textLa: Domine nomen tuum in æternum: Domine memoriale tuum in generationem et generationem.

verses.textEn: For the Lord will judge his people, and he will be petitioned by his servants.
verses.textLa: Quia iudicabit Dominus populum suum: et in servis suis deprecabitur.

verses.textEn: The idols of the Gentiles are silver and gold, the works of the hands of men.
verses.textLa: Simulacra Gentium argentum, et aurum, opera manuum hominum.
verses.notes: From a modern Catholic point of view, the Gentiles are the unbelievers, those who do not worship God, but only silver and gold.

verses.textEn: They have a mouth, and do not speak. They have eyes, and do not see.
verses.textLa: Os habent, et non loquentur: oculos habent, et non videbunt.

verses.textEn: They have ears, and do not hear. For neither is there any breath in their mouths.
verses.textLa: Aures habent, et non audient: neque enim est spiritus in ore ipsorum.

verses.textEn: Let those who make them become like them, along with all who trust in them.
verses.textLa: Similes illis fiant qui faciunt ea: et omnes, qui confidunt in eis.

verses.textEn: Bless the Lord, O house of Israel. Bless the Lord, O house of Aaron.
verses.textLa: Domus Israel benedicite Domino: domus Aaron benedicite Domino.

verses.textEn: Bless the Lord, O house of Levi. You who fear the Lord, bless the Lord.
verses.textLa: Domus Levi benedicite Domino: qui timetis Dominum, benedicite Domino.
verses.notes: The houses of Levi, etc. represent various groups of believers. Those who fear the Lord includes those who might not belong to an organized religion, but they do good and avoid evil, and they believe in God.

verses.textEn: The Lord is blessed from Zion, by those who dwell in Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Benedictus Dominus ex Sion, qui habitat in Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Confess to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Confitemini Domino quoniam bonus: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Confess to the God of gods, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Confitemini Deo deorum: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Confess to the Lord of lords, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Confitemini Domino dominorum: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: He alone performs great miracles, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Qui facit mirabilia magna solus: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: He made the heavens with understanding, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Qui fecit cælos in intellectu: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: He established the earth above the waters, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Qui firmavit terram super aquas: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: He made the great lights, for his mercy is eternal:
verses.textLa: Qui fecit luminaria magna: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: the sun to rule the day, for his mercy is eternal:
verses.textLa: Solem in potestatem diei: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: the moon and the stars to rule the night, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Lunam, et stellas in potestatem noctis: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: He struck Egypt along with their first-born, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Qui percussit Ægyptum cum primogenitis eorum: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: He led Israel away from their midst, for his mercy is eternal:
verses.textLa: Qui eduxit Israel de medio eorum: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: with a powerful hand and an outstretched arm, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: In manu potenti, et brachio excelso: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: He divided the Red Sea into separate parts, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Qui divisit Mare Rubrum in divisiones: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: And he led out Israel through the middle of it, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Et eduxit Israel per medium eius: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: And he shook off Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Et excussit Pharaonem, et virtutem eius in Mari Rubro: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: He led his people through the desert, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Qui traduxit populum suum per desertum: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: He has struck great kings, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Qui percussit reges magnos: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: And he has slaughtered strong kings, for his mercy is eternal:
verses.textLa: Et occidit reges fortes: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Sihon, king of the Amorites, for his mercy is eternal:
verses.textLa: Sehon regem Amorrhæorum: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: and Og, king of Bashan, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Et Og regem Basan: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius:

verses.textEn: And he granted their land as an inheritance, for his mercy is eternal:
verses.textLa: Et dedit terram eorum hereditatem: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: as an inheritance for his servant Israel, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Hereditatem Israel servo suo: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: For he was mindful of us in our humiliation, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Quia in humilitate nostra memor fuit nostri: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: And he redeemed us from our enemies, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Et redemit nos ab inimicis nostris: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: He gives food to all flesh, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Qui dat escam omni carni: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Confess to the God of heaven, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Confitemini Deo cæli: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Confess to the Lord of lords, for his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Confitemini Domino dominorum: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: A Psalm of David: to Jeremiah. Above the rivers of Babylon, there we sat and wept, while we remembered Zion.
verses.textLa: Psalmus David, Ieremiæ. Super flumina Babylonis, illic sedimus et flevimus: cum recordaremur Sion:

verses.textEn: By the willow trees, in their midst, we hung up our instruments.
verses.textLa: In salicibus in medio eius, suspendimus organa nostra.

verses.textEn: For, in that place, those who led us into captivity questioned us about the words of the songs. And those who carried us away said: “Sing us a hymn from the songs of Zion.”
verses.textLa: Quia illic interrogaverunt nos, qui captivos duxerunt nos, verba cantionum: Et qui abduxerunt nos: Hymnum cantate nobis de canticis Sion.

verses.textEn: How can we sing a song of the Lord in a foreign land?
verses.textLa: Quomodo cantabimus canticum Domini in terra aliena?

verses.textEn: If I ever forget you, Jerusalem, let my right hand be forgotten.
verses.textLa: Si oblitus fuero tui Ierusalem, oblivioni detur dextera mea.

verses.textEn: May my tongue adhere to my jaws, if I do not remember you, if I do not set Jerusalem first, as the beginning of my joy.
verses.textLa: Adhæreat lingua mea faucibus meis, si non meminero tui: Si non proposuero Ierusalem, in principio lætitiæ meæ.

verses.textEn: O Lord, call to mind the sons of Edom, in the day of Jerusalem, who say: “Despoil it, despoil it, even to its foundation.”
verses.textLa: Memor esto Domine filiorum Edom, in die Ierusalem: Qui dicunt: Exinanite, exinanite usque ad fundamentum in ea.

verses.textEn: O daughter of Babylon, have pity. Blessed is he who will repay you with your payment, which you have paid to us.
verses.textLa: Filia Babylonis misera: beatus, qui retribuet tibi retributionem tuam, quam retribuisti nobis.
verses.notes: This first part can be read as: ‘O daughter of Babylon, have pity,’ or as: ‘O pitiable (miserable) daughter of Babylon.’

verses.textEn: Blessed is he who will take hold of your little ones and dash them against the rock.
verses.textLa: Beatus, qui tenebit, et allidet parvulos tuos ad petram.

verses.textEn: Of David himself. O Lord, I will confess to you with my whole heart, for you have heard the words of my mouth. I will sing psalms to you in the sight of the Angels.
verses.textLa: Ipsi David. Confitebor tibi Domine in toto corde meo: quoniam audisti verba oris mei. In conspectu angelorum psallam tibi:

verses.textEn: I will adore before your holy temple, and I will confess your name: it is above your mercy and your truth. For you have magnified your holy name above all.
verses.textLa: adorabo ad templum sanctum tuum, et confitebor nomini tuo. Super misericordia tua, et veritate tua: quoniam magnificasti super omne, nomen sanctum tuum.

verses.textEn: On whatever day that I will call upon you: hear me. You will multiply virtue in my soul.
verses.textLa: In quacumque die invocavero te, exaudi me: multiplicabis in anima mea virtutem.

verses.textEn: May all the kings of the earth confess to you, O Lord. For they have heard all the words of your mouth.
verses.textLa: Confiteantur tibi Domine omnes reges terræ: quia audierunt omnia verba oris tui:
verses.notes: The Challoner Douay-Rheims version omits ‘O Lord’ (from the vocative Domine), but the original Douay-Rheims has it. Again, this is a small difference that indicates that the Latin text used by Challoner differs slightly from this text.

verses.textEn: And let them sing in accordance with the ways of the Lord. For great is the glory of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et cantent in viis Domini: quoniam magna est gloria Domini.

verses.textEn: For the Lord is exalted, and he looks with favor on the humble. But the lofty he knows from a distance.
verses.textLa: Quoniam excelsus Dominus, et humilia respicit: et alta a longe cognoscit.

verses.textEn: If I wander into the midst of tribulation, you will revive me. For you extended your hand against the wrath of my enemies. And your right hand has accomplished my salvation.
verses.textLa: Si ambulavero in medio tribulationis, vivificabis me: et super iram inimicorum meorum extendisti manum tuam, et salvum me fecit dextera tua.

verses.textEn: The Lord will provide retribution on my behalf. O Lord, your mercy is forever. Do not disdain the works of your hands.
verses.textLa: Dominus retribuet pro me: Domine misericordia tua in sæculum: opera manuum tuarum ne despicias.

verses.textEn: Unto the end. A Psalm of David. O Lord, you have examined me, and you have known me.
verses.textLa: In finem, Psalmus David. Domine probasti me, et cognovisti me:

verses.textEn: You have known my sitting down and my rising up again.
verses.textLa: tu cognovisti sessionem meam, et resurrectionem meam.

verses.textEn: You have understood my thoughts from afar. My path and my fate, you have investigated.
verses.textLa: Intellexisti cogitationes meas de longe: semitam meam, et funiculum meum investigasti.
verses.notes: The word ‘funiculum’ literally means ‘line’ or ‘cord,’ but it is often used to refer to an ancient type of casting lots, but which used a string and which was usually concerned with the outcome of future events (i.e. one’s fate).

verses.textEn: And you have foreseen all my ways. For there is no word in my tongue.
verses.textLa: Et omnes vias meas prævidisti: quia non est sermo in lingua mea.
verses.notes: In other words, there are no words that I can speak that God does not already know.

verses.textEn: Behold, O Lord, you have known all things: the newest and the very old. You have formed me, and you have placed your hand over me.
verses.textLa: Ecce Domine tu cognovisti omnia novissima, et antiqua: tu formasti me, et posuisti super me manum tuam.
verses.notes: Although ‘novissima’ means ‘the last,’ but it also means ‘the newest.’ The newest addition to a line of people will be the last in line.

verses.textEn: Your knowledge has become a wonder to me. It has been reinforced, and I am not able to prevail against it.
verses.textLa: Mirabilis facta est scientia tua ex me: confortata est, et non potero ad eam.

verses.textEn: Where will I go from your Spirit? And where will I flee from your face?
verses.textLa: Quo ibo a Spiritu tuo? et quo a facie tua fugiam?

verses.textEn: If I ascend into heaven, you are there. If I descend into Hell, you are near.
verses.textLa: Si ascendero in cælum, tu illic es: si descendero in infernum, ades.

verses.textEn: If I assume my feathers in early morning, and dwell in the utmost parts of the sea,
verses.textLa: Si sumpsero pennas meas diluculo, et habitavero in extremis maris:

verses.textEn: even there, your hand will lead me forth, and your right hand will hold me.
verses.textLa: Etenim illuc manus tua deducet me: et tenebit me dextera tua.

verses.textEn: And I said: Perhaps darkness will overwhelm me, and the night will be my illumination, to my delight.
verses.textLa: Et dixi: Forsitan tenebræ conculcabunt me: et nox illuminatio mea in deliciis meis.

verses.textEn: But darkness will not be impenetrable to you, and night will illuminate like the day: for just as its darkness is, so also is its light.
verses.textLa: Quia tenebræ non obscurabuntur a te, et nox sicut dies illuminabitur: sicut tenebræ eius, ita et lumen eius.

verses.textEn: For you have possessed my temperament. You have supported me from the womb of my mother.
verses.textLa: Quia tu possedisti renes meos: suscepisti me de utero matris meæ.

verses.textEn: I will confess to you, for you have been magnified terribly. Your works are miraculous, as my soul knows exceedingly well.
verses.textLa: Confitebor tibi quia terribiliter magnificatus es: mirabilia opera tua, et anima mea cognoscit nimis.

verses.textEn: My bone, which you have made in secret, has not been hidden from you, and my substance is in accord with the lower parts of the earth.
verses.textLa: Non est occultatum os meum a te, quod fecisti in occulto: et substantia mea in inferioribus terræ.

verses.textEn: Your eyes saw my imperfection, and all this shall be written in your book. Days will be formed, and no one shall be in them.
verses.textLa: Imperfectum meum viderunt oculi tui, et in libro tuo omnes scribentur: dies formabuntur, et nemo in eis.

verses.textEn: But to me, O God, your friends have been greatly honored. Their first ruler has been exceedingly strengthened.
verses.textLa: Mihi autem nimis honorificati sunt amici tui, Deus: nimis confortatus est principatus eorum.
verses.notes: The first ruler of God’s friends can be understood to refer to the Pope.

verses.textEn: I will number them, and they will be more numerous than the sand. I rose up, and I am still with you.
verses.textLa: Dinumerabo eos, et super arenam multiplicabuntur: exurrexi, et adhuc sum tecum.

verses.textEn: O God, if only you would cut down sinners. You men of blood: depart from me.
verses.textLa: Si occideris Deus peccatores: viri sanguinum declinate a me:

verses.textEn: For you say in thought: They will accept your cities in vain.
verses.textLa: Quia dicitis in cogitatione: accipient in vanitate civitates tuas.

verses.textEn: Have I not hated those who hated you, Lord, and wasted away because of your enemies?
verses.textLa: Nonne qui oderunt te Domine, oderam: et super inimicos tuos tabescebam?

verses.textEn: I have hated them with a perfect hatred, and they have become enemies to me.
verses.textLa: Perfecto odio oderam illos: et inimici facti sunt mihi.

verses.textEn: Examine me, O God, and know my heart. Question me, and know my paths.
verses.textLa: Proba me Deus, et scito cor meum: interroga me, et cognosce semitas meas.

verses.textEn: And see if there might be in me the way of iniquity, and lead me in the way of eternity.
verses.textLa: Et vide, si via iniquitatis in me est: et deduc me in via æterna.

verses.textEn: Unto the end. A Psalm of David.
verses.textLa: In finem, Psalmus David.

verses.textEn: Rescue me, O Lord, from the evil man. Rescue me from the iniquitous leader.
verses.textLa: Eripe me Domine ab homine malo: a viro iniquo eripe me.
verses.notes: Here we have two different Latin words (homine, viro) that are usually translated with the same English word, ‘man.’ But the Latin word ‘viro’ can refer to a particular type of man, such as a strong man, or a virtuous man, or a man with some degree of power and authority. So, in this context, ‘viro’ is best translated as ‘leader,’ rather than translating it as ‘man.’ This allows the English translation to reflect the different use of the words in Latin: ‘homine,’ and ‘viro.’

verses.textEn: Those who have devised iniquities in their hearts: all day long they constructed conflicts.
verses.textLa: Qui cogitaverunt iniquitates in corde: tota die constituebant prælia.

verses.textEn: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent. The venom of asps is under their lips.
verses.textLa: Acuerunt linguas suas sicut serpentis: venenum aspidum sub labiis eorum.

verses.textEn: Preserve me, O Lord, from the hand of the sinner, and rescue me from men of iniquity. They have decided to supplant my steps.
verses.textLa: Custodi me Domine de manu peccatoris: et ab hominibus iniquis eripe me. Qui cogitaverunt supplantare gressus meos:

verses.textEn: The arrogant have hidden a snare for me. And they have stretched out cords for a snare. They have placed a stumbling block for me near the road.
verses.textLa: absconderunt superbi laqueum mihi: Et funes extenderunt in laqueum: iuxta iter scandalum posuerunt mihi.

verses.textEn: I said to the Lord: You are my God. O Lord, heed the voice of my supplication.
verses.textLa: Dixi Domino: Deus meus es tu: exaudi Domine vocem deprecationis meæ.

verses.textEn: Lord, O Lord, the strength of my salvation: you have overshadowed my head in the day of war.
verses.textLa: Domine, Domine virtus salutis meæ: obumbrasti super caput meum in die belli:

verses.textEn: O Lord, do not hand me over to the sinner by my desire. They have plotted against me. Do not abandon me, lest they should triumph.
verses.textLa: Ne tradas me Domine a desiderio meo peccatori: cogitaverunt contra me, ne derelinquas me, ne forte exaltentur.

verses.textEn: The head of those who encompass me, the labor of their lips, will overwhelm them.
verses.textLa: Caput circuitus eorum: labor labiorum ipsorum operiet eos.

verses.textEn: Burning coals will fall upon them. You will cast them down into the fire, into miseries that they will not be able to withstand.
verses.textLa: Cadent super eos carbones, in ignem deiicies eos: in miseriis non subsistent.

verses.textEn: A talkative man will not be guided aright upon the earth. Evils will drag the unjust man unto utter ruin.
verses.textLa: Vir linguosus non dirigetur in terra: virum iniustum mala capient in interitu.

verses.textEn: I know that the Lord will accomplish justice for the needy and vindication for the poor.
verses.textLa: Cognovi quia faciet Dominus iudicium inopis: et vindictam pauperum.

verses.textEn: So then, truly, the just will confess your name, and the upright will dwell with your countenance.
verses.textLa: Verumtamen iusti confitebuntur nomini tuo: et habitabunt recti cum vultu tuo.

verses.textEn: A Psalm of David. O Lord, I have cried out to you, hear me. Attend to my voice, when I cry out to you.
verses.textLa: Psalmus David. Domine clamavi ad te, exaudi me: intende voci meæ, cum clamavero ad te.

verses.textEn: Let my prayer be guided like incense in your sight: the lifting up of my hands, like the evening sacrifice.
verses.textLa: Dirigatur oratio mea sicut incensum in conspectu tuo: elevatio manuum mearum sacrificium vespertinum.

verses.textEn: O Lord, station a guard over my mouth and a door enclosing my lips.
verses.textLa: Pone Domine custodiam ori meo: et ostium circumstantiæ labiis meis.

verses.textEn: Do not turn aside my heart to words of malice, to making excuses for sins, with men who work iniquity; and I will not communicate, even with the best of them.
verses.textLa: Non declines cor meum in verba malitiæ, ad excusandas excusationes in peccatis, cum hominibus operantibus iniquitatem: et non communicabo cum electis eorum.

verses.textEn: The just one will correct me with mercy, and he will rebuke me. But do not allow the oil of the sinner to fatten my head. For my prayer will still be toward their good will.
verses.textLa: Corripiet me iustus in misericordia, et increpabit me: oleum autem peccatoris non impinguet caput meum. Quoniam adhuc et oratio mea in beneplacitis eorum:
verses.notes: This last part is saying that we should not only pray for what sinners need, but even for what is pleasing to them, as long as it is good for them. Even though the Just One rebukes me, and God rightly keeps me from getting a fat head by association with sinners, I still pray for what sinners need and even whatever good things will please them.

verses.textEn: Their judges have been engulfed, joined to the rocks. They will hear my words, which have prevailed,
verses.textLa: absorpti sunt iuncti petræ iudices eorum. Audient verba mea quoniam potuerunt:

verses.textEn: as when the lava of the earth has erupted above ground. Our bones have been scattered beside Hell.
verses.textLa: sicut crassitudo terræ erupta est super terram. Dissipata sunt ossa nostra secus infernum:

verses.textEn: For Lord, O Lord, my eyes look to you. In you, I have hoped. Do not take away my soul.
verses.textLa: quia ad te Domine, Domine oculi mei: in te speravi, non auferas animam meam.

verses.textEn: Protect me from the snare that they have set up for me and from the scandals of those who work iniquity.
verses.textLa: Custodi me a laqueo, quem statuerunt mihi: et a scandalis operantium iniquitatem.

verses.textEn: The sinners will fall into his net. I am alone, until I pass over.
verses.textLa: Cadent in retiaculo eius peccatores: singulariter sum ego donec transeam.

verses.textEn: The understanding of David. A prayer, when he was in the cave.
verses.textLa: Intellectus David, Cum esset in spelunca, oratio.

verses.textEn: With my voice, I cried out to the Lord. With my voice, I made supplication to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Voce mea ad Dominum clamavi: voce mea ad Dominum deprecatus sum:

verses.textEn: In his sight, I pour out my prayer, and before him, I declare my tribulation.
verses.textLa: Effundo in conspectu eius orationem meam, et tribulationem meam ante ipsum pronuncio.

verses.textEn: Though my spirit may become faint within me, even then, you have known my paths. Along this way, which I have been walking, they have hidden a snare for me.
verses.textLa: In deficiendo ex me spiritum meum, et tu cognovisti semitas meas. In via hac, qua ambulabam, absconderunt laqueum mihi.

verses.textEn: I considered toward the right, and I looked, but there was no one who would know me. Flight has perished before me, and there is no one who has concern for my soul.
verses.textLa: Considerabam ad dexteram, et videbam: et non erat qui cognosceret me. Periit fuga a me, et non est qui requirat animam meam.

verses.textEn: I cried out to you, O Lord. I said: You are my hope, my portion in the land of the living.
verses.textLa: Clamavi ad te Domine, dixi: Tu es spes mea, portio mea in terra viventium.

verses.textEn: Attend to my supplication. For I have been humbled exceedingly. Free me from my persecutors, for they have been fortified against me.
verses.textLa: Intende ad deprecationem meam: quia humiliatus sum nimis. Libera me a persequentibus me: quia confortati sunt super me.

verses.textEn: Lead my soul out of confinement in order to confess your name. The just are waiting for me, until you repay me.
verses.textLa: Educ de custodia animam meam ad confitendum nomini tuo: me expectant iusti, donec retribuas mihi.

verses.textEn: A Psalm of David, when his son Absalom was pursuing him. O Lord, hear my prayer. Incline your ear to my supplication in your truth. Heed me according to your justice.
verses.textLa: Psalmus David, Quando persequebatur eum Absalom filius eius. Domine exaudi orationem meam: auribus percipe obsecrationem meam in veritate tua: exaudi me in tua iustitia.

verses.textEn: And do not enter into judgment with your servant. For all the living will not be justified in your sight.
verses.textLa: Et non intres in iudicium cum servo tuo: quia non iustificabitur in conspectu tuo omnis vivens.

verses.textEn: For the enemy has pursued my soul. He has lowered my life to the earth. He has stationed me in darkness, like the dead of ages past.
verses.textLa: Quia persecutus est inimicus animam meam: humiliavit in terra vitam meam. Collocavit me in obscuris sicut mortuos sæculi:

verses.textEn: And my spirit has been in anguish over me. My heart within me has been disturbed.
verses.textLa: et anxiatus est super me spiritus meus, in me turbatum est cor meum.

verses.textEn: I have called to mind the days of antiquity. I have been meditating on all your works. I have meditated on the workings of your hands.
verses.textLa: Memor fui dierum antiquorum, meditatus sum in omnibus operibus tuis: in factis manuum tuarum meditabar.

verses.textEn: I have extended my hands to you. My soul is like a land without water before you.
verses.textLa: Expandi manus meas ad te: anima mea sicut terra sine aqua tibi:

verses.textEn: O Lord, heed me quickly. My spirit has grown faint. Do not turn your face away from me, lest I become like those who descend into the pit.
verses.textLa: Velociter exaudi me Domine: defecit spiritus meus. Non avertas faciem tuam a me: et similis ero descendentibus in lacum.

verses.textEn: Make me hear your mercy in the morning. For I have hoped in you. Make known to me the way that I should walk. For I have lifted up my soul to you.
verses.textLa: Auditam fac mihi mane misericordiam tuam: quia in te speravi. Notam fac mihi viam, in qua ambulem: quia ad te levavi animam meam.

verses.textEn: O Lord, rescue me from my enemies. I have fled to you.
verses.textLa: Eripe me de inimicis meis Domine, ad te confugi:

verses.textEn: Teach me to do your will. For you are my God. Your good Spirit will lead me into the righteous land.
verses.textLa: doce me facere voluntatem tuam, quia Deus meus es tu. Spiritus tuus bonus deducet me in terram rectam:

verses.textEn: For the sake of your name, O Lord, you will revive me in your fairness. You will lead my soul out of tribulation.
verses.textLa: propter nomen tuum Domine vivificabis me, in æquitate tua. Educes de tribulatione animam meam:

verses.textEn: And you will scatter my enemies in your mercy. And you will destroy all those who afflict my soul. For I am your servant.
verses.textLa: et in misericordia tua disperdes inimicos meos. Et perdes omnes, qui tribulant animam meam: quoniam ego servus tuus sum.

verses.textEn: A Psalm of David versus Goliath. Blessed is the Lord, my God, who trains my hands for the battle and my fingers for the war.
verses.textLa: Psalmus David Adversus Goliath. Benedictus Dominus Deus meus, qui docet manus meas ad prælium, et digitos meos ad bellum.

verses.textEn: My mercy and my refuge, my supporter and my deliverer, my protector and him in whom I have hoped: he subdues my people under me.
verses.textLa: Misericordia mea, et refugium meum: susceptor meus, et liberator meus: Protector meus, et in ipso speravi: qui subdit populum meum sub me.

verses.textEn: O Lord, what is man that you have become known to him? Or the son of man that you consider him?
verses.textLa: Domine quid est homo, quia innotuisti ei? aut filius hominis, quia reputas eum?

verses.textEn: Man has been made similar to vanity. His days pass by like a shadow.
verses.textLa: Homo vanitati similis factus est: dies eius sicut umbra prætereunt.

verses.textEn: O Lord, incline your heavens and descend. Touch the mountains, and they will smoke.
verses.textLa: Domine inclina cælos tuos, et descende: tange montes, et fumigabunt.

verses.textEn: Send a flash of lightning, and you will scatter them. Shoot your arrows, and you will set them in disarray.
verses.textLa: Fulgura coruscationem, et dissipabis eos: emitte sagittas tuas, et conturbabis eos:

verses.textEn: Send forth your hand from on high: rescue me, and free me from many waters, from the hand of the sons of foreigners.
verses.textLa: Emitte manum tuam de alto, eripe me, et libera me de aquis multis: de manu filiorum alienorum.

verses.textEn: Their mouth has been speaking vain things, and their right hand is the right hand of iniquity.
verses.textLa: Quorum os locutum est vanitatem: et dextera eorum, dextera iniquitatis.

verses.textEn: To you, O God, I will sing a new song. On the psaltery, with an instrument of ten strings, I will sing psalms to you.
verses.textLa: Deus canticum novum cantabo tibi: in psalterio, decachordo psallam tibi.

verses.textEn: He gives salvation to kings. He has redeemed your servant David from the malignant sword.
verses.textLa: Qui das salutem regibus: qui redemisti David servum tuum de gladio maligno:

verses.textEn: Rescue me, and deliver me from the hand of the sons of foreigners. Their mouth has been speaking vain things, and their right hand is the right hand of iniquity.
verses.textLa: eripe me. Et erue me de manu filiorum alienorum, quorum os locutum est vanitatem: et dextera eorum, dextera iniquitatis:

verses.textEn: Their sons are like new plantings in their youth. Their daughters are dressed up: adorned all around like the idols of a temple.
verses.textLa: Quorum filii, sicut novellæ plantationes in iuventute sua. Filiæ eorum compositæ: circumornatæ ut similitudo templi.

verses.textEn: Their cupboards are full: overflowing from one thing into another. Their sheep bear young, brought forth in abundance.
verses.textLa: Promptuaria eorum plena, eructantia ex hoc in illud. Oves eorum fœtosæ, abundantes in egressibus suis:

verses.textEn: Their cattle are fat. There is no ruined wall or passage, nor anyone crying out in their streets.
verses.textLa: boves eorum crassæ. Non est ruina maceriæ, neque transitus: neque clamor in plateis eorum.

verses.textEn: They have called the people that has these things: blessed. But blessed is the people whose God is the Lord.
verses.textLa: Beatum dixerunt populum, cui hæc sunt: beatus populus, cuius Dominus Deus eius.

verses.textEn: The Praise of David himself. I will extol you, O God, my king. And I will bless your name, in this time and forever and ever.
verses.textLa: Laudatio ipsi David. Exaltabo te Deus meus rex: et benedicam nomini tuo in sæculum, et in sæculum sæculi.

verses.textEn: Throughout every single day, I will bless you. And I will praise your name, in this time and forever and ever.
verses.textLa: Per singulos dies benedicam tibi: et laudabo nomen tuum in sæculum, et in sæculum sæculi.

verses.textEn: The Lord is great and exceedingly praiseworthy. And there is no end to his greatness.
verses.textLa: Magnus Dominus et laudabilis nimis: et magnitudinis eius non est finis.

verses.textEn: Generation after generation will praise your works, and they will declare your power.
verses.textLa: Generatio et generatio laudabit opera tua: et potentiam tuam pronunciabunt.

verses.textEn: They will tell of the magnificent glory of your sanctity. And they will discourse of your wonders.
verses.textLa: Magnificentiam gloriæ sanctitatis tuæ loquentur: et mirabilia tua narrabunt.

verses.textEn: And they will talk about the virtue of your terrible acts. And they will describe your greatness.
verses.textLa: Et virtutem terribilium tuorum dicent: et magnitudinem tuam narrabunt.

verses.textEn: They will shout about the memory of your abundant sweetness. And they will exult in your justice.
verses.textLa: Memoriam abundantiæ suavitatis tuæ eructabunt: et iustitia tua exultabunt.

verses.textEn: The Lord is compassionate and merciful, patient and full of mercy.
verses.textLa: Miserator et misericors Dominus: patiens, et multum misericors.

verses.textEn: The Lord is sweet to all things, and his compassion is upon all his works.
verses.textLa: Suavis Dominus universis: et miserationes eius super omnia opera eius.

verses.textEn: O Lord, may all your works confess to you, and let your holy ones bless you.
verses.textLa: Confiteantur tibi Domine omnia opera tua: et sancti tui benedicant tibi.

verses.textEn: They will speak of the glory of your kingdom, and they will declare your power,
verses.textLa: Gloriam regni tui dicent: et potentiam tuam loquentur:

verses.textEn: so as to make known to the sons of men your power and the glory of your magnificent kingdom.
verses.textLa: Ut notam faciant filiis hominum potentiam tuam: et gloriam magnificentiæ regni tui.

verses.textEn: Your kingdom is a kingdom for all ages, and your dominion is with all, from generation to generation. The Lord is faithful in all his words and holy in all his works.
verses.textLa: Regnum tuum regnum omnium sæculorum: et dominatio tua in omni generatione et generationem. Fidelis Dominus in omnibus verbis suis: et sanctus in omnibus operibus suis.

verses.textEn: The Lord lifts up all who have fallen down, and he sets upright all who have been thrown down.
verses.textLa: Allevat Dominus omnes, qui corruunt: et erigit omnes elisos.

verses.textEn: O Lord, all eyes hope in you, and you provide their food in due time.
verses.textLa: Oculi omnium in te sperant Domine: et tu das escam illorum in tempore opportuno.

verses.textEn: You open your hand, and you fill every kind of animal with a blessing.
verses.textLa: Aperis tu manum tuam: et imples omne animal benedictione.

verses.textEn: The Lord is just in all his ways and holy in all his works.
verses.textLa: Iustus Dominus in omnibus viis suis: et sanctus in omnibus operibus suis.

verses.textEn: The Lord is near to all who call upon him, to all who call upon him in truth.
