verses.textLa: Prope est Dominus omnibus invocantibus eum: omnibus invocantibus eum in veritate.

verses.textEn: He will do the will of those who fear him, and he will heed their supplication and accomplish their salvation.
verses.textLa: Voluntatem timentium se faciet, et deprecationem eorum exaudiet: et salvos faciet eos.

verses.textEn: The Lord watches over all who love him. And he will destroy all sinners.
verses.textLa: Custodit Dominus omnes diligentes se: et omnes peccatores disperdet.

verses.textEn: My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord, and may all flesh bless his holy name, in this time and forever and ever.
verses.textLa: Laudationem Domini loquetur os meum: et benedicat omnis caro nomini sancto eius in sæculum, et in sæculum sæculi.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Of Haggai and Zachariah.
verses.textLa: Alleluia, Aggæi, et Zachariæ.

verses.textEn: Praise the Lord, O my soul. I will praise the Lord with my life. I will sing psalms to my God as long as I shall be. Do not trust in the leaders,
verses.textLa: Lauda anima mea Dominum, laudabo Dominum in vita mea: psallam Deo meo quamdiu fuero. Nolite confidere in principibus:
verses.notes: The phrase ‘in vita mea’ could be translated as ‘in my life’ or ‘with my life.’ Adding ‘in my life’ to ‘I will praise the Lord’ adds little meaning. Whenever you praise God, it occurs during your life. However, the phrase ‘with my life’ adds significant meaning to the phase ‘I will praise the Lord,’ because it indicates that the praise is not merely with words, nor even with a few deeds, but that one’s entire life becomes a way of praising God.

verses.textEn: in the sons of men, in whom there is no salvation.
verses.textLa: in filiis hominum, in quibus non est salus.

verses.textEn: His spirit will depart, and he will return to his earth. In that day, all their thoughts will perish.
verses.textLa: Exibit spiritus eius, et revertetur in terram suam: in illa die peribunt omnes cogitationes eorum.

verses.textEn: Blessed is he whose help is the God of Jacob: his hope is in the Lord God himself,
verses.textLa: Beatus, cuius Deus Iacob adiutor eius, spes eius in Domino Deo ipsius:

verses.textEn: who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all the things that are in them.
verses.textLa: qui fecit cælum et terram, mare, et omnia, quæ in eis sunt.

verses.textEn: He preserves the truth forever. He executes judgment for those who suffer injury. He provides food for the hungry. The Lord releases those who are bound.
verses.textLa: Qui custodit veritatem in sæculum, facit iudicium iniuriam patientibus: dat escam esurientibus. Dominus solvit compeditos:

verses.textEn: The Lord enlightens the blind. The Lord sets upright those who have been thrown down. The Lord loves the just.
verses.textLa: Dominus illuminat cæcos. Dominus erigit elisos, Dominus diligit iustos.

verses.textEn: The Lord watches over new arrivals. He will support the orphan and the widow. And he will destroy the ways of sinners.
verses.textLa: Dominus custodit advenas, pupillum et viduam suscipiet: et vias peccatorum disperdet.

verses.textEn: The Lord shall reign forever: your God, O Zion, from generation to generation.
verses.textLa: Regnabit Dominus in sæcula, Deus tuus Sion, in generationem et generationem.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Praise the Lord, because the psalm is good. Delightful and beautiful praise shall be for our God.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Laudate Dominum quoniam bonus est psalmus: Deo nostro sit iucunda, decoraque laudatio.

verses.textEn: The Lord builds up Jerusalem. He will gather together the dispersed of Israel.
verses.textLa: Ædificans Ierusalem Dominus: dispersiones Israelis congregabit.

verses.textEn: He heals the contrite of heart, and he binds up their sorrows.
verses.textLa: Qui sanat contritos corde: et alligat contritiones eorum.

verses.textEn: He numbers the multitude of the stars, and he calls them all by their names.
verses.textLa: Qui numerat multitudinem stellarum: et omnibus eis nomina vocat.

verses.textEn: Great is our Lord, and great is his virtue. And of his wisdom, there is no number.
verses.textLa: Magnus Dominus noster, et magna virtus eius: et sapientiæ eius non est numerus.

verses.textEn: The Lord lifts up the meek, but he brings down the sinner, even to the ground.
verses.textLa: Suscipiens mansuetos Dominus: humilians autem peccatores usque ad terram.

verses.textEn: Sing before the Lord with confession. Play psalms to our God on a stringed instrument.
verses.textLa: Præcinite Domino in confessione: psallite Deo nostro in cithara.

verses.textEn: He covers heaven with clouds, and he prepares rain for the earth. He produces grass on the mountains and herbs for the service of men.
verses.textLa: Qui operit cælum nubibus: et parat terræ pluviam. Qui producit in montibus fœnum: et herbam servituti hominum.

verses.textEn: He gives their food to beasts of burden and to young ravens that call upon him.
verses.textLa: Qui dat iumentis escam ipsorum: et pullis corvorum invocantibus eum.

verses.textEn: He will not have good will for the strength of the horse, nor will he be well pleased with the legs of a man.
verses.textLa: Non in fortitudine equi voluntatem habebit: nec in tibiis viri beneplacitum erit ei.

verses.textEn: The Lord is well pleased with those who fear him and with those who hope in his mercy.
verses.textLa: Beneplacitum est Domino super timentes eum: et in eis, qui sperant super misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem. Praise your God, O Zion.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Lauda Ierusalem Dominum: lauda Deum tuum Sion.

verses.textEn: For he has reinforced the bars of your gates. He has blessed your sons within you.
verses.textLa: Quoniam confortavit seras portarum tuarum: benedixit filiis tuis in te.

verses.textEn: He has stationed peace at your borders, and he has satisfied you with the fat of the grain.
verses.textLa: Qui posuit fines tuos pacem: et adipe frumenti satiat te.

verses.textEn: He sends forth his eloquence to the earth. His word runs swiftly.
verses.textLa: Qui emittit eloquium suum terræ: velociter currit sermo eius.

verses.textEn: He provides snow like wool. He strews clouds like ashes.
verses.textLa: Qui dat nivem sicut lanam: nebulam sicut cinerem spargit.

verses.textEn: He sends his ice crystals like morsels. Who can stand firm before the face of his cold?
verses.textLa: Mittit crystallum suum sicut buccellas: ante faciem frigoris eius quis sustinebit?

verses.textEn: He will send forth his word, and it will melt them. His Spirit will breathe out, and the waters will flow.
verses.textLa: Emittet verbum suum, et liquefaciet ea: flabit Spiritus eius, et fluent aquæ.
verses.notes: Or, more literally, ‘His wind will blow and the waters will flow.’ The translation of ‘His Spirit will breathe’ clarifies and emphasizes the spiritual meaning of the text.

verses.textEn: He announces his word to Jacob, his justices and his judgments to Israel.
verses.textLa: Qui annunciat verbum suum Iacob: iustitias, et iudicia sua Israel.

verses.textEn: He has not done so much for every nation, and he has not made his judgments manifest to them. Alleluia.
verses.textLa: Non fecit taliter omni nationi: et iudicia sua non manifestavit eis. Alleluia.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Praise the Lord from the heavens. Praise him on the heights.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Laudate Dominum de cælis: laudate eum in excelsis.

verses.textEn: Praise him, all his Angels. Praise him, all his hosts.
verses.textLa: Laudate eum omnes angeli eius: laudate eum omnes virtutes eius.

verses.textEn: Praise him, sun and moon. Praise him, all stars and light.
verses.textLa: Laudate eum sol et luna: laudate eum omnes stellæ, et lumen.

verses.textEn: Praise him, heavens of the heavens. And let all the waters that are above the heavens
verses.textLa: Laudate eum cæli cælorum: et aquæ omnes, quæ super cælos sunt,

verses.textEn: praise the name of the Lord. For he spoke, and they became. He commanded, and they were created.
verses.textLa: laudent nomen Domini. Quia ipse dixit, et facta sunt: ipse mandavit, et creata sunt.

verses.textEn: He has stationed them in eternity, and for age after age. He has established a precept, and it will not pass away.
verses.textLa: Statuit ea in æternum, et in sæculum sæculi: præceptum posuit, et non præteribit.

verses.textEn: Praise the Lord from the earth: you dragons and all deep places,
verses.textLa: Laudate Dominum de terra, dracones, et omnes abyssi.

verses.textEn: fire, hail, snow, ice, windstorms, which do his word,
verses.textLa: Ignis, grando, nix, glacies, spiritus procellarum: quæ faciunt verbum eius:

verses.textEn: mountains and all hills, fruitful trees and all cedars,
verses.textLa: Montes, et omnes colles: ligna fructifera, et omnes cedri.

verses.textEn: wild beasts and all cattle, serpents and feathered flying things,
verses.textLa: Bestiæ, et universa pecora: serpentes, et volucres pennatæ:

verses.textEn: kings of the earth and all peoples, leaders and all judges of the earth,
verses.textLa: Reges terræ, et omnes populi: principes, et omnes iudices terræ.

verses.textEn: young men and virgins. Let the older men with the younger men, praise the name of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Iuvenes, et virgines: senes cum iunioribus laudent nomen Domini:

verses.textEn: For his name alone is exalted.
verses.textLa: quia exaltatum est nomen eius solius.

verses.textEn: Confession of him is beyond heaven and earth, and he has exalted the horn of his people. A hymn to all his holy ones, to the sons of Israel, to a people close to him. Alleluia.
verses.textLa: Confessio eius super cælum, et terram: et exaltavit cornu populi sui. Hymnus omnibus sanctis eius: filiis Israel, populo appropinquanti sibi. Alleluia.
verses.notes: The word ‘confessio’ can refer to confessing or admitting something (e.g. that God is Lord of heaven and earth). It can also refer to an acknowledgment or understanding about something (e.g. having a belief in God). Such an admission or acknowledgment often has a pervasive element of praise and thanksgiving to God. However, the translation of ‘confessio’ as if it meant merely ‘to give praise’ is not accurate.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Sing to the Lord a new song. His praise is in the Church of the saints.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Cantate Domino canticum novum: laus eius in Ecclesia sanctorum.

verses.textEn: Let Israel rejoice in him who made them, and let the sons of Zion exult in their king.
verses.textLa: Lætetur Israel in eo, qui fecit eum: et filii Sion exultent in rege suo.

verses.textEn: Let them praise his name in chorus. Let them sing psalms to him with the timbrel and the psaltery.
verses.textLa: Laudent nomen eius in choro: in tympano, et psalterio psallant ei:

verses.textEn: For the Lord is well pleased with his people, and he will exalt the meek unto salvation.
verses.textLa: Quia beneplacitum est Domino in populo suo: et exaltabit mansuetos in salutem.

verses.textEn: The saints will exult in glory. They will rejoice upon their couches.
verses.textLa: Exultabunt sancti in gloria: lætabuntur in cubilibus suis.

verses.textEn: The exultations of God will be in their throat, and two-edged swords will be in their hands:
verses.textLa: Exaltationes Dei in gutture eorum: et gladii ancipites in manibus eorum:

verses.textEn: to obtain vindication among the nations, chastisements among the peoples,
verses.textLa: Ad faciendam vindictam in nationibus: increpationes in populis.

verses.textEn: to bind their kings with shackles and their nobles with manacles of iron,
verses.textLa: Ad alligandos reges eorum in compedibus: et nobiles eorum in manicis ferreis.

verses.textEn: to obtain judgment over them, as it has been written. This is glory for all his saints. Alleluia.
verses.textLa: Ut faciant in eis iudicium conscriptum: gloria hæc est omnibus sanctis eius. Alleluia.

verses.textEn: Alleluia. Praise the Lord in his holy places. Praise him in the firmament of his power.
verses.textLa: Alleluia. Laudate Dominum in sanctis eius: laudate eum in firmamento virtutis eius.

verses.textEn: Praise him for his virtues. Praise him according to the multitude of his greatness.
verses.textLa: Laudate eum in virtutibus eius: laudate eum secundum multitudinem magnitudinis eius.
verses.notes: The word ‘virtutibus’ or ‘virtutis’ is often translated as ‘power.’ However, it has a broader meaning in Latin that can mean ‘power,’ or ‘virtue,’ or ‘excellence.’

verses.textEn: Praise him with the sound of the trumpet. Praise him with psaltery and stringed instrument.
verses.textLa: Laudate eum in sono tubæ: laudate eum in psalterio, et cithara.

verses.textEn: Praise him with timbrel and choir. Praise him with strings and organ.
verses.textLa: Laudate eum in tympano, et choro: laudate eum in chordis, et organo.

verses.textEn: Praise him with sweet-sounding cymbals. Praise him with cymbals of jubilation.
verses.textLa: Laudate eum in cymbalis benesonantibus: laudate eum in cymbalis iubilationis:

verses.textEn: Let every spirit praise the Lord. Alleluia.
verses.textLa: omnis spiritus laudet Dominum. Alleluia.
